job_title: Associate Production Manager (Feature Animation & VFX)Vancouver, BC
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing Services, and Software Development
description:
Description




Position at Industrial Light & Magic


Position Summary

The Associate Production Manager works closely with the Coordinators on the project in keeping the show operating in an organized and efficient manner. The APM will oversee the show sequence or discipline schedules and help guide them in order to have a comprehensive sequence or overall show schedule, depending on project size. Associate Production Managers also work with and delegate to the project Production Assistants.

What You'll Do



Establish a show schedule and work closely with the Coordinators in order to maintain a strong overall schedule. In addition, may involve coordinating for a specific group (discipline) of artists (or multiple groups) on any given project.

Work closely with the Producer and Production Manager to bid shot work.

Report to Project (“Show”) Producer and Production Manager potential issues that may affect the schedule or workflow.

Correspond with client regarding reviews, schedule, and needs.

Supports discipline supervisors and/or leads in crewing, casting and scheduling bodies of work, keeping in mind the overall show schedule, client reviews, bids, and other discipline needs.

Establish a process for communicating discipline targets, assignments, and priorities to discipline or sequence crews, as well as the overall show crew. This should be daily and/or weekly.

Schedule, track, and manage assigned work within Shotgun as well as working with Production Managers to display the information in a physical and digital form (magnet boards / conference rooms/online tools) in order to be visible to the team.

Ensure work is on schedule for each department and is meeting internal and external (client) deadlines. 

Track client needs, reviews and deliveries to make sure all disciplines hit their targets.

Keep a weekly synopsis of discipline and/or sequence accomplishments and next steps.

Serve as key communication liaison between all parties relevant to your work. Provide updates, priorities, reschedules, and status of all shots at any given moment. 

Anticipate and communicate issues to leadership team(s) to reach solutions in a timely manner. 

Act as primary point person for organizing dailies/shot reviews throughout the day on behalf of your discipline Supe/Lead. Take notes regarding feedback and decisions made and enter any required information into Shotgun/communicate to all so as to provide updates to all others impacted.

On relevant shows, oversee outsourced work so that vendors’ bids and schedule flow with the overall show schedule, and confirm that vendors’ bids and schedule are in line with the goals of the show.

Technical ability and understanding required to run Linux, Windows, and Mac-based programs for reviews with crew (dailies), clients, external vendors, and various meetings.

 Conference room, Viewstation and basic technical setup and troubleshooting (running generic scripts to resolve issues). Prioritization and escalation of technical support issues. 

Perform special projects as needed. 



Additional Responsibilities as Needed on Shows:



May accompany VFX Supervisor and Matchmover on location for blue screen and principle photography work. Oversees for camera reports, shot information sheets, and matchmove information. Must be able to recognize and report back to ILM production any changes to shots that affect the budget.

Serve as the main point person between the Production and VFX Editors. Discuss cut lengths, key frame numbers, editorial discrepancies and other specifics regarding film.

Reserve equipment and resources needed for location and stage work; monitor schedules to avoid conflicts.



What We're Looking For



Bachelor’s degree in Film, Art, Drama or related field or equivalent work experience required.

Significant previous experience in production to include strong working knowledge of post production techniques and terminology.

Proficiency in Macs/PCs including Microsoft Word and Excel. Knowledge of UNIX required.

Must possess very strong organizational and communication skills and be able to handle a variety of tasks in an efficient manner while meeting deadlines.

Ability to work on a computer/keyboard for long periods of time

Ability to work overtime on an ongoing basis

Ability to travel as needed

Must have the ability to juggle multiple projects, work with diverse personalities and work within strict deadlines.

Attention to detail, follow through and strong communication skills.



This position is with Lucasfilm Entertainment Company Ltd. LLC, which is part of a business segment we call Industrial Light & Magic. Lucasfilm Entertainment Company Ltd. LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Lucasfilm fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world. **FOR U.S. BASED NEW HIRES ONLY:** We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best - entertain and inform millions around the world. As part of our commitment to health and safety, COVID-19 vaccines are required for current U.S. salaried and non-union hourly employees, as well as all newly hired U.S. employees.

Lucas

Lucas

Lucas o90Zdfw5

8150 Parkhill Drive

Milton, Ontario, L9T5V7

Canada


Do you want to work for a Global Company that supplies some of the World's Largest brand name customers? We are an innovative packaging solutions provider and are looking for a Production Manager to join our Milton team.




Opportunity Summary



Our Milton, Ontario Corrugated Plant is hiring a Production Manager. The Production Manager is responsible for the day-to-day activities of maintaining the plant facility operations, including safety policies, personnel, housekeeping, maintenance, production activities, customer requirements, planning and scheduling. The PM will serve as a member of the management leadership team and must contribute to achieving sales objectives. The Production Manager will also serve as a coach to team members and assist in the development and evaluation of direct reports.



How You Will Impact WestRock




 Provide leadership and guidance on the coordination of the 24/7 plant activities through planning with Superintendents to ensure the manufacturing objectives are accomplished in a timely and cost-effective manner

 Review customer requirements and specifications to identify improvement opportunities and implement solutions to increase customer satisfaction

 Coordinate and maintain ongoing, effective, safety plans to ensure program adoption and implementation

 Offer new ideas to support fulfillment of department goals and procedures for continuous improvement, retention of customer base, company profitability, and employee job satisfaction

 Develop and manage defined communication channels across various stakeholder groups to build effective relationships and produce superior products

 Manage P&L, capital expenditures, manufacturing costs and operating efficiencies to improve plant profitability

 Monitor and control waste management to manage production costs and reduce environmental impacts




What You Need To Succeed




 High School diploma or G.E.D.

 7 to 10 years of experience in manufacturing industry

 7 plus years of related leadership experience in a production facility

 Demonstrated mechanical acumen

 Proven experience using scheduling software

 Ability to work in fast paced JIT (just-in-time) manufacturing environment

 Demonstrated expertise in process management to ensure production efficiency

 Relentless determination and courage to make things happen; strong execution skills; results-oriented

 Ability to respond quickly to changing demands, processes, and updated information

 Demonstrated understanding of quality processes and continuous improvement, such as Six Sigma certification

 Excellent communication skills and ability to interact across all levels of the organization, while accomplish organizational goals

 Demonstrated knowledge of capital management (P&L and capital budgets) and analyzing financial data

 Established courses of action for self and/or others to accomplish specific planning goals




Why Work For WestRock




 Competitive Salary and bonus plan

 Comprehensive Benefits Plan from the first day of hire

 Company matched DC Pension Plan from the first day of hire

 Employee Stock Purchase Plan

 A Company focused on continuous learning with Tuition Reimbursement Plan

A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety, and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.

A management team committed to WestRock's values of Respect, Accountability, Integrity and Excellence


As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, WestRock will, upon request from the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact WestRock, Human Resources at (905)864-4003 about your needs and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.

Apply to www.westrock.com/careers . ATR15196.

If you’re looking for an opportunity to join and grow with a dynamic company, you will thrive at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group!

Come and Lead our exceptional and dynamic, experienced Maintenance TEAM!        


What your day will look like as a Maintenance Production Manager with Execaire:


The maintenance production manager (MPM) will be responsible for all aircraft maintenance and NDT (Non Destructive Testing) activities.

The MPM will look after the overall management and administration of the Execaire maintenance and NDT departments.

Are you a bilingual licensed AME with 5-8 years of experience managing a diverse Maintenance Team?

Don’t miss this opportunity. Send your resume to Peter Hehn at Peter.hehn@innotech-execaire.com

Company Description



This job application remains open even when we don’t have roles available. If you would like to be considered, please apply and we will contact you as soon as we have an opening


With offices all over the globe, MPC is one of the world's leading visual effects studios, creating high-end VFX for the advertising and feature film industries. We are constantly looking for the best talent in the world, enthusiastic people that come to work every day with the desire to be a part of some of the best work in the industry.

Our teams in London, and throughout our global network of studios, produce creative, visually stunning and technically challenging VFX and digital projects of the highest quality, and we are looking for candidates with a desire to be involved in the success of these projects


Job Description


We have created a collaborative team environment where Artists and Production work alongside each other to deliver stunning, award-winning visual effects for our Clients.

The Central Production Manager is responsible for the people management of the Production crew within the facility, as well as the overall delivery of projects within that facility.


Plan & structure the production team for new and existing shows

Directly manage PC’s and PA’s, including contract extensions, performance management, probation reviews, salaries, quarterly evaluations, etc.

Plan for, hire and onboard new production starters

Support the production team to ensure quotas are being met on time and within budget for all projects

Support overall team engagement, such as arranging quarterlies/socials


The CPM will drive the learning development and effective training of their team and innovate efficiencies with the global central production team.


Diagnose problems or inefficiencies within the structure and identify improvements for production tools

Review and update hard and soft skill training content for the production team

Participate in Compliance reporting to ensure consistency and good performance across all Direct Reports

Create procedures and documentation for Production

Using proficiency in production tools, support and train the production team, answer any questions, and ensure best practices are known and understood

Support the movement of team members into the Production Pathways program for career development


The CPM champions a positive and productive culture of high performance, supporting the brand as a global industry leader in visual effects.


Support and manage ad hoc projects as requested to improve global efficiency

Work with technology to create new shows when awarded, support on client visits, etc.

Provide production support for newly awarded projects, ensuring strong show set up, and working with Business Development on potential pitch work

In collaboration with the global production team, ensure MPC standards are being met

Be an advocate of diversity and inclusivity, and act as an ambassador to promote MPC film within the local film community



Qualifications



VFX CPM Essentials



Previous experience in VFX scheduling & pipeline, minimum of 3 years

Previous experience in people and project management

Strong time management, initiative and decision-making skills

Strong interpersonal skills

Strong organization skills & attention to detail

Team player who can build relationships and manage teams, including difficult conversations

Ability to work with and inspire a team

Good presentation skills, confidence in presenting to executives



Any Of The Following Technical Skills Is a Bonus



MS Office packages, specifically Office 365

Shotgun

Render management

Timesheet tools



Additional Information

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to tcstalent@technicolor.com and we'll be happy to assist.

job_title: Delivery Manager, Product Reliability and Operations
description:
The Legal Technology Infrastructure and Operations group is seeking a Delivery Manager to join our team in Toronto, Canada. This is a key technical role that will lead, empower, and coordinate a skilled technical team of individuals toward delivering enterprise technology solutions. This operational team is responsible for HighQ a modern, adaptable legal work solution.

https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/highq


About The Role


In this opportunity as a 

Delivery Manager,

 you will:


Be a People Leader: manage a team of technologists with varied skills and experience levels. Coach and mentor current and future leaders within the team, be responsible for proactively identifying individual training needs, conducting performance reviews, and maintaining a healthy team culture

Be a Project Leader: train/coach team members in project delivery. Strategically plan, design, and implement software to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously

Be a Technical Leader: HighQ operates in a public cloud and private cloud and the team consists of SRE, DevOps, and Datacenter Operations to support the environments.

Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager: collaborate and engage with stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, and project management in defining the roadmap for products and processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues

Be a Decision Maker: make quick and effective date-driven decisions with good problem solving and analytical skills, and roll-out strategy that aligns with company goals 

Be an Effective Communicator: Effectively articulate complex problems, concepts, and solutions to varied audiences

Focus on Continuous Improvement and Technical Standards: drive improvements in productivity, software quality, and reliability. Foster a continuous learning culture and curiosity about emerging technologies




About You



Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required, Computer Science or related technical degree preferred

5 years of relevant experience in software development, architecture, and/or technology leadership

Proven ability to set direction and inspire team members to engage and deliver on a vision

Broad understanding of technology stacks used to build distributed application systems

Hands-on experience using the Agile project management methodology

Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Hands-on experience with programming and scripting languages

Comfortable in a fast-paced environment and motivated by complex technical and business challenges




What’s in it For You: 


You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your

personal and professional growth through:


Hybrid Work Model: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote throughout 2021. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.

Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.

Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.

Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.

Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.



Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.


Accessibility 


As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.



Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.



More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

job_title: VFX Production Manager / Gestionnaire de Projet aux Effets Visuels
description:
Company Description



This job application remains open even when we don’t have roles available. If you would like to be considered, please apply and we will contact you as soon as we have an opening


The Moving Picture Company (MPC) is a global creative studio with a single goal: to create experiences that move people. With decades of storytelling experience, we are perpetually pushing the limits of what is technologically and artistically possible to tell visually stunning stories.

MPC continues to lead in an ever-evolving industry, building authentic and long-lasting connections with audiences across all channels.

For more information about MPC – Partners in storytelling – www.mpcfilm.com


Job Description


In partnership with Producers, VFX Supervisors and CG Supervisors, the Production Manager oversees the day-to-day of the project.

The PM is involved in the team management and training of coordinators and production. The PM must maintain a high level and global overview of the project and its progress. You’ll balance deliveries against Producer set quotas and stay in alignment with discipline shot teams, adjusting when needed to ensure schedules are aligned.

Other duties include render forecasting and managing the nightly/weekend rendering schedule; priority management and ensuring that all materials for client review are sent out.


Qualifications



Production Manager Essentials:



Proven experience of strategic scheduling within VFX

Highly organized and analytical

Good use of initiative, decision-making and issue management with the ability to drive issues through to resolution; prioritization and delegation; time management

Experience in creation, planning and implementation of small and large projects

Managing difficult conversations; managing remote teams; teamwork and training others

VFX Film Industry knowledge and Show experience



Additional Information

Alerte emploi - Gestionnaire de production


Peinture Mauricie inc. est à la recherche d’un gestionnaire de production. 

La principale fonction du gestionnaire de production est d’assister l’entrepreneur dans la gestion de la production des travaux de peinture intérieurs, extérieurs et commerciaux de l'entreprise. Ce rôle est composé de plusieurs activités : la formation et l'accompagnement des peintres en bâtiment, la gestion de la production, le contrôle de la qualité et le service à la clientèle.




Les tâches du gestionnaire consistent à assister l'équipe de peintre en bâtiment en préparant adéquatement les chantiers et en s'assurant que les travaux se déroulent comme prévus. Ces tâches s'exécutent autant sur la route qu'au siège social de l'entreprise.





Exigences et qualifications requises



15h/semaine (janvier à mi-avril)

40h/semaine (mi-avril à septembre)

Organisé, prévoyant et travaillant

Bonne capacité de leadership et de gestion du personnel

Avoir de bonnes habiletés de communication






Salaire



Salaire de 17$/h

Bonis de performances allant jusqu’à 15 500$/an

Autres avantages





Faire parvenir votre CV à info@peinturemauricie.ca

Company Description


Mikros Animation is a global CGI animation studio located in Paris, Montreal, Los Angeles, Bangalore and London, dedicated to feature films and episodic content. Since its inception, Mikros Animation has always put creativity and CG artistry at the heart of its animation and production activities, allowing our artists to work across a great variety of stories with a high level of stylized craft. So far, Mikros Animation has contributed to ten released feature animations and to numerous high-quality animated series, for the world’s best-known animation studios, either as creative studio, line producer or executive producer. Mikros Animation has also produced more than 250 hours of programming, broadcast by notable channels including Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon, TF1, France TV, Gulli, M6, Gloob, and Super RTL. Our animated episodic content airs and streams globally, in over 180 countries.

At Mikros Animation, we believe great animation is about making real connections with real people. By partnering with filmmakers to unite their creative visions, with our industry-leading craftsmanship and artistry, we create characters that connect with audiences on an authentic and emotional level to bring powerful stories to life.


Job Description


Reporting to the Head of Production, the Production Manager has an essential role in production. You will be responsible for the day-to-day management of the production activities. You will guarantee the respect of the schedules, the quality of the deliverables to reach the objectives defined by the production. You will work closely with the Head of Production, Producer, CG Supervisor and Departments Supervisors to manage changes in planning.


Assist the Head of Production in the development of production strategy.

Maintain overall production schedule and manage departmental quotas.

Make recommendations for improvements to production workflow, particularly with-respect-to scheduling, flow of information and resource management.

Send weekly report to the Head of Production with Production Updates.

Maintain production crew lists updated.

Approve artistes time sheets.

Daily interaction with the client on production related needs and deliveries.



Qualifications



More than 3 years of experience as production manager or production coordinator

Experience in the production of 3D animation

In-depth knowledge of the production and animation workflow

Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite, especially with Excel

Good knowledge of Shotgun software or similar is required

Bilingual French / English is required



Additional Information

Carpenter Canada Co. has an immediate opening for a Production Manager at our Woodbridge, ON manufacturing plant. This position is responsible for safe, accurate and timely fulfillment of customer orders while adhering to the Company’s guiding principles and value of order.

Working for Carpenter Canada Co. means:

Have a permanent, full-time and stable position with the possibility of advancement;

Have group insurance paid by the employer;

Have a competitive salary;

Have a pension plan with employer contribution;

Easy access location;

Free parking.

Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following:

Supervision:

Plan work and distribute tasks to employees

Apply company policies

Complete and approve payroll timesheets

Ensure the use of PPE and zero tolerance for at-risk behavior and unsafe work.

Collaborate with HR to address employee inquiries

Performance management

Report daily department results at daily meetings.

Identify appropriate corrective actions and implement corrective actions.

Find out from stakeholders about the priorities and needs in the plant.

Give appropriate feedback to employees.

Participate in the continuous improvement process and recognize opportunities.

Complete the monthly occupational health and safety training.

Perform health and safety inspections.

Administration

Produce or complete the necessary administrative forms: HR, quality management, etc.

Follow up with appropriate telephone and email follow-ups.

Report quality issues to the quality department.

Qualifications:

Experience / education / skills

Post-secondary education.

3 - 5 years of production experience in a lean manufacturing environment.

3 - 5 years of production supervisor experience is required.

Problem-solving and decision-making capabilities.

Demonstrated communication skills.

Experience working with SAP or similar systems is an asset.

Must possess high-level proficiency with MS Office Suite.

Carpenter Canada Co. is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or other legally protected characteristic.

job_title: VFX Production Manager / Gestionnaire de Projet aux Effets Visuels
description:
Company Description


The Moving Picture Company (MPC) is a global creative studio with a single goal: to create experiences that move people. With decades of storytelling experience, we are perpetually pushing the limits of what is technologically and artistically possible to tell visually stunning stories.

MPC continues to lead in an ever-evolving industry, building authentic and long-lasting connections with audiences across all channels.

For more information about MPC – Partners in storytelling – www.mpcfilm.com


Job Description


In partnership with Producers, VFX Supervisors and CG Supervisors, the Production Manager oversees the day-to-day of the project.

The PM is involved in the team management and training of coordinators and production. The PM must maintain a high level and global overview of the project and its progress. You’ll balance deliveries against Producer set quotas and stay in alignment with discipline shot teams, adjusting when needed to ensure schedules are aligned.

Other duties include render forecasting and managing the nightly/weekend rendering schedule; priority management and ensuring that all materials for client review are sent out.


Qualifications



Production Manager Essentials:



Experience in project management

Proven experience of strategic scheduling in a creative industry

Highly organized and analytical

Good use of initiative, decision-making and issue management with the ability to drive issues through to resolution; prioritization and delegation; time management

Experience in creation, planning and implementation of small and large projects

Managing difficult conversations; managing remote teams; teamwork and training others

FX Film Industry knowledge and Show experience is a plus

About Q4


At Q4, we hustle, we grind and we grow. As the team members that make up #Q4orce, we care, we compete and we support each other every day. We’re on a mission to deliver a best-in-class client experience driven by technology, data, and of course, our people.

As the leading provider of website, analytics and virtual events solutions to investor relations and the capital markets, Q4 is a trusted partner to over 2,400 of the world’s most successful public companies and institutions – and we are growing at an incredible pace. We’re on our way to becoming the largest capital markets platform company in the world. That’s where you come in.

We hire smart, curious, and talented people to push boundaries, reimagine what’s possible and turn challenges into opportunities, all while keeping the needs of our clients at the heart of everything we do.

This is your opportunity to be a part of something special. Join us!


The gig.


As an Event Manager (EM) at Q4, you will be responsible for; client liaison, production, monitoring and quality assurance for Q4 run events. Each quarter clients running an event will be assigned an Event Manager to oversee the webcast and/or conference call, as well as other event add-ons.

EMs will be responsible for working directly with clients to see the event through booking, pre-event activities, production of the live event, post event follow up, as well as archiving. In addition to event creation, monitoring and post event tasks, the Event Manager will work with the support team and dedicated Investor Relations Leads to ensure the event goes live on client websites.

Outside of busy earnings seasons, EMs will work as part of a team to continually refine and improve the Event process. This includes, but is not limited to, forecasting and building events in advance of the next quarter, increasing efficiencies by vetting and adopting new tools, as well as redefining internal processes to ensure a great client experience. Attention to detail, time management and outstanding client service skills will lead you to great success in this role.


Responsibilities include: 



Build and produce quarterly earnings and ad hoc webcasts using our webcasting platform.

Book and manage earnings and ad hoc conference calls through Q4’s vendors.

Work directly with clients to execute on webcast and conference call events, while providing excellent customer service and ensuring the event runs smoothly.

Coordinate all elements of an event with the assigned client. i.e: Receiving slides, scripts and Q&A lists. Quality Assurance (QA) of events through proper preparation and addressing of potential issues as they arise.

Coordinate user training on system/new functionality and respond to more complex user queries regarding system functionality. (IE: PMXD, Leaderview, stream tests)

Ability to identify when/if an event requires an add-on service such as a stream test or pre record.

Coordinate and manage support ticket handoffs for event publishing on client websites.

Work closely with other teams (Investor Relations Lead and Support) to ensure the success of each event.

Stay up to date on the latest webcast trends and technology advances in order to provide clients with market leading best practices.

Troubleshoot and immediately escalate webcast and conference call issues.

Be a team player and show willing to hustle and take on projects outside of day to day responsibilities

Be inquisitive nature with the ability to imagine and execute on increasing team and company efficiencies.




Education / Skills: 



University or College Degree in media, communications or equivalent (in progress or completed)

Working knowledge of PC and/or Mac-based environments

Experience using Audacity or similar audio editing software an asset

Experience with Zendesk ticketing software or equivalent

Digital/web experience is a must. Technical, Mobile Apps and Financial experience are a bonus




Qualifications:



1-2 years experience in a client facing role in an office environment

Able to follow detailed processes

Exceptional organizational and time management skills

Ability to verbally communicate instructions and direction clearly and effectively

Ability to handle a fast paced, high pressure environment

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Digital event production background an asset (such as webcasting/webinars, AV setups)

Willing to work outside of regular business hours (9-5) with the potential of extended hours during peak earnings periods




Why Q4? 


We are motivated by solving complex problems in unorthodox ways. Emphasis on your well-being means you experience your true potential. We offer a variety of benefits to ensure you can always work hard and have fun:


 Health, wellness and lifestyle benefits to balance your heart, mind, and body.

 Pension matching and Employee Equity Incentives to support your financial health.

 Unlimited paid time off so you can really recharge and enjoy life. Enough said.

 Flexible working environment. Choose your home, one of our trendy offices or mix it up.

 Virtual team building and socials. Keeping people connected is important.

 And an amazing culture to top it all off!




Join #Q4orce


A career at Q4 means joining a team that thrives in a fast paced, high growth environment; one that is focused on providing growth opportunities, encouraging diversity & inclusion and working to inspire an entrepreneurial spirit. We’re thrilled to be able say that the Q4 team and culture have even won some awards along the way including being recognized as one of Canada's Best Workplaces for Women and Technology.

Q4 values diversity and people of all backgrounds and abilities. Should you require any accommodations prior to or during the interview process, please contact hr@q4inc.com.

Position Summary: You will have worked in a theatre or large multi-purpose entertainment venue and/or have national touring experience. You have comprehensive knowledge of the technical needs of a diverse entertainment and arts program as well be able to demonstrate comprehensive training in safe working practices.

You will provide technical support to all events presented by Casino New Brunswick as well as third party promoters. You will provide technical support for all technical elements within the Hotel, Centre and Casino. You will manage all aspects of Health & Safety relative to the use of stage technical installations and associated equipment and administer systems to demonstrate good housekeeping. You will respond to customers technical needs including design and creative work. You will represent and be responsible for all aspects of the venue lighting, audio and video elements as well as operating. This is inclusive of lighting elements installed in other areas of the property for design purposes.



Key Responsibilities




 Reports to the Entertainment Director (and/or assigned Department Director(s) as required

 Provide a warm, welcoming and inviting atmosphere for all visitors, artists and their staff, and staff to the casino event center

 Correspond and advance all aspects of production with Artist's Production Manager and Venue Entertainment Director

 Monitor and order consumable lighting, audio, video supplies and rental equipment as required

 Responds to general telephone, e-mail and in-person inquires as required

 Responsible to assist as required performing artists and their touring staff as required on show days

 Responsible to work on all show days within the venue to ensure adequate staff is present to execute a particular event

 Responsible to book and manage outside labor for Corporate Events, Third Party Rentals as well as Casino New Brunswick presented shows

 Responsible for maintaining a shared master show file system for all technical aspects of the show as well as facilitating the execution of all contracts.

 Responsible for ordering all required supplies, rentals and consumable goods for the department.

 Responsible for assisting, designing and or operating as required for special events and third party bookings

 Participate in client consultations

 The Production Manager is responsible for the creation of the design for a given production as required

 Establish an in-house lighting plot and maintain a working inventory of fixtures

 Attend and Participate in Managers retreats as well as Monthly Meetings

 Other duties as assigned




Education And Qualification Requirements




 College or University Diploma in a related field; Equivalent work experience will be considered

 Previous administration experience required

 Previous experience in a live entertainment venue

 Previous touring experience

 Working knowledge of live entertainment practices

 Experience working with financials and budgets

 Excellent telephone and communication skills

 Exceptional organizational skills

 Strong interpersonal skills

 Computer literacy including efficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint and Email

 Experience maintaining a comprehensive filing system

 Self starter and ability to work independently; results oriented

 Ability to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment

 Working knowledge of live entertainment practices

 Working knowledge of the Grand MA and MA Lite

 Experience working with financials and budgets

 Bilingualism (French/English) is an asset




Work Environment Conditions




 This position requires physical labor with respect to the set up and installation of equipment

 Work within a 24/7 operation with ability to work flexible hours when required (days, evening, nights, weekends and holidays)

 Willing to submit to a criminal record check with results acceptable to our organization, standards and position, and/or obtain and maintain an NBLGC license registration

 Must have employment eligibility in Canada

 Must be 19 years of age or older


Special Working Conditions: Our reputation is of paramount importance. As such, we will conduct our business in an ethical and professional manner. Every team member will be obliged to understand and follow all of the policies outlined in Great Canadian's Corporate Ethics & Conduct Manual and will disclose any irregularities or wrongdoing in accordance with the Company's Whistleblower Policy.

The Company is committed to sound internal control policies and practices. Every team member will follow the internal control practices required of their position and department.

Compliance Requirements: Every team member must comply with all requirements of the Corporate Ethics and Conduct Manual and with all other corporate policies as communicated. Every team member will be familiar with the business process documentation and internal control objectives related to their position and how their job description aligns with specific internal control activities for which they are responsible. Every team member must adhere to all Company and regulatory policies as they relate to functions of the position.

Licensing and Certification Requirements: Permanent employment may be dependent upon the authorization and continued approval of the Provincial/State Regulatory Bodies. New employees may be required to complete an application and, if required, will begin work only after regulatory approval is granted. Existing team members will reapply as necessary, and continuing work will be dependent upon successful reapplication. For positions that require additional certification, the appropriate level of certification will be maintained

description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Finance and Operations
 Job Details 


Global Procurement and Sourcing (GPS) manages company spend for all categories including Technology, Corporate and Professional Services, Real Estate, Marketing, Meetings and Events, and Travel. This is a global function which supports the sourcing, negotiation, procurement and supplier program management for all regions. GPS reports into the office of the CFO and is comprised of approximately 200 professionals worldwide.



Role Description



We are looking for a Manager/Sr. Category Manager to support the Marketing category
. 
This person is responsible for driving the category strategy within the following marketing sub-categories: Advertising, Production, Public Relations, Design, Creative, Print, Co-Marketing, Partner-Referrals, and Sponsorships. This role reports to the Sr. Director of Services Sourcing.

The Manager/Sr. Category Manager will partner with marketing to drive a category strategy that aligns with business and sourcing priorities. This candidate is responsible leading large-scale negotiations and building cross-functional partnership for an optimized value proposition.

Success in this position requires a high-energy, self-motivated professional with marketing category experience, sourcing/contracting experience, excellent communication, relationship building, and influencing skills, as well as an understanding of the technology market.



Your Impact




Drive the development and execution of the Sourcing category strategy

Use industry peers, associations, market intel to advise and guide sourcing strategy

Become a Trusted Advisor to all key partners

Develop vital partnerships and nurture a positive business relationship with internal partners and suppliers; delivering on short and long term business objectives, and goals

Propose, build and drive opportunities to improve value proposition

Collaborate with global Sourcing peers to find opportunities to use global buying power




Minimum Requirements




BA/BS degree, or equivalent experience in business management

6+ years of experience in Strategic Sourcing/Procurement focused on the Marketing category

Advanced understanding of supplier contracts

Strong communication skills, both written and oral

Experience in building and performing category strategies

Demonstrated contract negotiation experience




Preferred Requirements




Prior successful executive engagement experience

Knowledge of procure-to-pay processes

Prior experience working within a fast paced, sophisticated, and large global organization

industries: Food and Beverage Manufacturing and Farming
description:
Our client is committed to the long-term development of your career in the field of agriculture and will provide the opportunity to grow your understanding of all aspects of their industry. They offer extremely competitive compensation and benefits package to qualified candidates who share their vision for company growth.




Our client requires a Sales and Production Manager to be their grower and industry contact in the Peace Region. This relationship-based role involves face-to-face contact with growers; regularly travelling within the region to build relationships, negotiate grower contracts and to purchase seed for regional resale and international distribution.




To be considered for this Sales and Production Manager, you offer:


A highly motivated personality combined with strong interpersonal and contract negotiation skills

A strong ability to effectively manage your time

A background in agronomy is required; post-secondary education or applicable certification in agriculture is preferred.

It would be an asset if you have experience in forage, turf, cereal and/or oilseed crop production.

A valid driver's license is required as there will be regular local travel within the Peace Region.





As you work alongside the growers, you will be their agronomic and marketing consultant, ensuring they maximize their potential and seed quality; working with the production team to ensure products are processed and shipped on time and to customer specifications.

Our client specializes in the production and distribution of seeds in Canada and around the world. This Canadian company has growing demand for their products.




To apply for this Sales and Production Manager position click 'apply' and follow the self-serve application process. Don’t miss out on this great opportunity. APPLY NOW! Or contact Blair at 1.844.778.1031 to confidentially discuss the selection process and to establish your interest and intent to proceed. 




NOTE: Candidates applying for this position must have the proper work authorization to work in Canada in order to be considered for this position. Canada visa sponsorship is 
NOT
 available for this role. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, we will not consider your job application as we are not licensed to assist with immigration. Those with temporary work permits or those located outside of Canada cannot be retained in our database.




While we appreciate all applications, only those selected for an interview would be contacted. As per Grasslands Group of Companies Privacy Policy, all correspondence is confidential.




Grasslands Recruitment Specialists - Connecting Canadian Agriculture since 1996!

description:

 Job Category 
Sales
 Job Details 



The Team


The team reports into Sales Operations and with the primary goal to make Sales more efficient. More specifically, we ensure our customer data is accurate and organized in a useful way. In addition, as the centralized custodian of customer data, our work affects other critical areas across the company. The team works cross-functionally and always looks to automate processes to keep up with Salesforce’s growth.


The Role


Reporting to the Director of Data Strategy and Operations, this role entails both operational and strategic work. It requires a mix of skills including partner management, requirements gathering, meticulous documentation, program and project management, and Salesforce platform knowledge.



Primary Responsibilities Include




Own the maintenance of our customer object in our own Salesforce instance (20%): this object defines who is our customer and supports several cross-functional business processes. This responsibility makes the role high visibility- partners will know your name and come to you for help.

Drive strategic re-design and implementation of our customer definition (60%): you will understand and detail how ~20 groups inside of Salesforce use our customer definition. You will then translate these requirements into a solution by working with an automation team.

Represent your team in a company-wide initiative to redesign our internal data architecture platform (20%): Salesforce has launched a multi-year, company-wide, strategic project to support our future growth. You will support




Required Skills And Experience




Analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills to influence collaborators and to partner across functions and teams

8+ years of total work experience. Experience in management consulting, operations management, or similar position at a fast-growing technology company preferred.

5+ years of professional experience crafting and leading cross-functional and strategic projects, including business requirement generation and process analysis/ design

Understanding of Salesforce object model and basic Admin concepts

Ability to handle and prioritize competing priorities and projects

job_title: Bakery Production Manager - Full time with Benefits - Whitby or Oshawa
industries: Restaurants, Food and Beverage Services, and Retail
description:
Baker

COBS Bread Whitby & Oshawa is looking for 
Bakery Production Leads
 to join our team. A 
minimum
 of one year of baking and management experience is required. A baking education is desirable. We provide a fun work environment, comprehensive training, and excellent opportunities for career advancement.


What’s in it for you?



The satisfaction of baking from scratch, and pride in seeing the finished product you’ve helped to create

Potential for growth and development opportunities, including certified COBS Bread Baker Training and e-Learning

Complimentary products on us every shift

And more, including benefits for all full time employees.




As a Baker at COBS Bread, you will:



Work as part of a small team to bake products from scratch early each morning, following carefully crafted recipes

Be responsible for reading production schedules and recipes, measuring and mixing ingredients, molding and shaping dough, and processing everything through the ovens

You'll also work alongside your team to keep the bakery clean, and provide delightful customer service.




About COBS Bread


COBS Bread is part of Bakers Delight – an Australian-owned company established in 1980 operating as Bakers Delight in Australia and New Zealand, and as COBS Bread in Canada and the USA. Together we have grown to more than 700 bakeries across Australia, New Zealand, Canada and the USA. The entire network employs over 15,000 people, serving more than 2.1 million customers each week. All of COBS Bread’s baked goods are made on the same day they are sold, ensuring that everything is fresh and delightful. Any unsold items are donated daily to various local charities and food banks. The company's success can be attributed to the quality of our product, the development of our people and our warm and friendly customer service.


Accessibility


Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially


Requirements



You’re a morning person as shifts start as early as 4 AM

You have your own transportation as your shifts will often start earlier than public transit is available

You have a positive attitude, good organizational skills, and a strong sense of urgency.

Weekend work is a requirement as is work on all public holidays.




Physical Requirements



Continuous standing/ walking for all tasks

Frequent lifting and carrying up to 9 kg., occasional lifting and carrying up to 22 kg 

Frequent turning and reaching

Constant use of both hands, with frequent wrist rotation and flexing, occasional forceful gripping

Occasional pushing, pulling and some forward bending

Possess or be willing to complete First Aid and Food Safe Certifications




Benefits



What’s in it for you?



A fun work environment

 The satisfaction of baking from scratch, and pride in seeing the finished product you’ve helped create

Potential for growth and development opportunities, including certified COBS Bread Baker Training and e-Learning

Complimentary products on us every shift 

And more, including benefits for all full time employees.




While we thank you for your interest, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada to be considered for employment.

job_title: Program Manager - Guest & Educator Engagement, Inventory Intelligence
description:
Who We Are




 Description & Requirements 


lululemon is a yoga-inspired technical apparel company up to big things. The practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. We are proud to be a growing global company with locations all around the world, from Vancouver to Shanghai, and places in between. We owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in.



About This Team



This role supports the leadership team accountable for the strategy, engineering, and delivery of technology to enable educator and guest transactions and experiences in stores and our guest education center, provide B2B capabilities, and provide cross channel enterprise services for Inventory and Payments.



A Day In The Life



This person is a strategic partner that drives change through stakeholder influence, partnership, investigation and digging into the unknown, enabling focus and growth in our Guest & Educator Engagement and Inventory Intelligence Programs. The Program Manager, provides management and oversight for the projects within the program:


 Manage, drive and support operations for teams, including intake process, peak support and production on-call support plans 

 Responsible for overseeing the programs budgets and supporting Technology Manager in AOP planning 

 Lead program delivery in partnership with technology and business teams 

 Develops strong working partnerships with technology leaders and business teams to effectively achieve objectives for the programs 

 Champion project management best practices and processes 

 Provide strategic guidance and thought leadership on program/project management to the work-streams and cross-functional partners 

 Collaborate with a variety of business and cross functional stakeholders 

 Support both internal and external partnerships from strategy-to-delivery to ensure that roadmap priorities meet our business expectations and needs 

 Support the engineering teams and 3rd party vendors on prioritization of those features and functions that will be most important for the programs 

 Support business and technology leadership with updating strategy, executive presentations, roadmaps, KPIs, prioritizing budget across work-streams and communicating key deliverables to working teams 

 Support with actions around portfolio & operations transformation (such as delivery frameworks and tools, process improvement etc.) 

 Ensure team members have the tools, resources, and information they need to perform their jobs effectively and remove barriers to allow team to be as efficient as possible 

 Uses appropriate strategies and actions to overcome resistance to change and capitalize on forces in support of change 




Qualifications




 Minimum of 10 years working in technology or a related field 

 5-7+ years in program/portfolio management role and/or 3-5+ years consulting or executive management role 

 Proven track record of governing program within related field and ability to lead large scale, cross-functional, global initiatives 

 Ability to influence and manage conversations and meetings across the organization at multiple levels, particularity around strategic issues to bring structure to ambiguous environments 

 Proven ability to meet deadlines and operating under tight time constraints with a strong sense of urgency 

 Project Management Professional (PMP) nice to have 

 Change Management Certification (PROSCI) nice to have 

 Process Improvement Certification (Lean Six Sigma) nice to have 

 Ability to translate ideas into clear, high impact communications to executives, managers, employees and business partners 

 Ability to excel in an ambiguous environment 

 Demonstrated ability to function in a fast-paced, multi-program environment with changing priorities 

 Ability to anticipate potential problems and proactively troubleshoot to resolve issues 

 Exceptional leadership skills including the ability to influence and gain consensus in the absence of direct authority and beyond the scope of the position 

 Proven results working with global and remote teams across different time zones 




Must Haves




 Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life 

 Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results 

 Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same 

 Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure 

 Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships 

 Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously

The Planner - Production Schedule will be responsible for scheduling the detail planning shop orders in line with the requirements of the build sequence and master integrated schedule of the project. This position will report to Manager, Outfit & Onboard Planning and has no direct reports.






 
Duties/Accountabilities



Applying Primavera project planning tool to develop and maintain detail shop order schedules

Ensures interface between P6 schedules and MRP system (IFS) are maintained at the detail planning level 5 & 6

Coordinates with Detail Planners, Area Managers, Trade Supervisors to keep the detail schedules updated in P6 and MRP system (IFS)

Prepare and distribute weekly and monthly project status reports to production support organization

Liaises with key subcontract partners to integrate their detail schedule with the shipyard trade schedules

Acts as the link between the Stage of Construction (SOC) based Production Control Technologist and Detail Planners

Other duties as assigned.






Education and Experience



2 - 4 years planning/scheduling experience in a large manufacturing/heavy industry environment, preferably in the shipbuilding industry.

Certification by an accredited society in Planning, Production Control and/or Project Management is highly desirable.

Experience using an ERP system in a large manufacturing environment






Skills, Knowledge and Required Competencies



Proficiency working with independent planning systems including Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project.

Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and demonstrated inventory and material management experience a distinct advantage.

Excellent time management skills.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Strong organisational skills.

Very detailed and analytical nature with the ability to identify and report issues in a timely manner.

Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office based packages such as Word/Excel/PowerPoint.

Demonstrated ability to multi-task, prioritise and change direction when required.

Ability to function as a team member and liaise effectively with various functions.





Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

industries: Software Development, Entertainment Providers, and Computer Games
description:
The Crowds Supervisor plays an integral role in the production team. In collaboration with the show leadership, they will aid in determining the creative and technical approach for the generation of all crowd imagery for the show, using simulation techniques to populate large numbers of characters, animals, and vehicles that deliver compelling performances. This is a regular, full time, staff position that will be located at our Vancouver, BC studio. Please note that relocation eligibility may be determined based on role and individual circumstance.


Responsibilities : 



Role Specifics




Supervise a Crowds team, working in conjunction with the show leadership, to identify and implement crowd production workflow processes, enabling the Director’s vision to be realized.

Collaborate with show leadership to plan, prepare, and produce all crowd assets/shots for the show.

Collaborate closely with the identified Animation Supervisor who is tasked with crowd cycle generation

Participate in the coordination of Production/Technology crowd tool development specific for the show and in context with the Studio as a whole.

Direct the continuing maintenance and optimization of the entire crowd production process.


Implementation




Responsible for consumability and efficiency of artist deliverables into downstream departments. 

Participates in department processes, bidding, and reviews.

Assesses resource needs and collaborates with department leadership in helping find staffing solutions. 


Leading People




Creates an inclusive and safe work environment by carefully managing sensitive information, making rooms feel open and comfortable, creating space for everyone to have a voice, and addressing bias when it occurs. 

Guides the creative and technical vision/expectations for the team members. 

In tight conjunction with the VFX Supervisor, Production Management, and Department Manager, inspires and motivates the team. 

Contributes to the overall craft and development of team members through setting expectations, delivering consistent constructive feedback, recognition, and accountability. 


Collaboration




Models and fosters a collaborative work environment between individuals on the team and across departments. 

Identifies solutions and compromises in partnership with other supervisors.


Communication




Provides regular updates to direct leaders on the progress, health, and direction of the team. 

Keeps the team informed with context for show related changes and updates. 


Studio Stewardship




Studio Culture- Actively fosters an inclusive, innovative, and collaborative environment so every employee can contribute at the highest levels. 

Technology, Tools, and Workflow- Engages in the creation and execution of technical standards, pipeline conventions, and workflows to support the department, show, and studio.

Department Stewardship- Partners closely with peers and Department Manager to support an environment of creativity, trust, and innovation. Actively involved in assessment, casting, hiring, and overall growth of artists. 




Basic Qualifications : 


Minimum 2 years of leadership experience that demonstrates a strong ability to lead and mentor others.

Experience as a Crowd Supervisor or similar role in CG Animation and/or Visual Effects production.

Ability to quickly learn and adapt to WDAS standards, pipeline, tools and workflows as they relate to the discipline you would be leading. 

Understanding of the disciplines/craft which they would be leading.

Bachelor's degree or higher in Art, Illustration, Cinema Studies, Computer Graphics, Engineering or equivalent experience.

Has a combined technical and creative background.

Experience with all aspects of computer graphics.

Experience and technical understanding of digital pipeline issues.

Ability to architect new technology and write code where required.

Strong knowledge of each of the following technical areas:


Maya®

Houdini®

3D Modeling, Rigging, Camera and Animation, Simulation and Effects

3D Texture painting and mapping techniques

3D Lighting and Compositing techniques

The Unix/Linux environment

Python scripting

C/C++


Skill in the following areas is desired:


Traditional drawing, painting, design and/or sculpture

Knowledge of anatomy, kinematics and physical behaviors




Additional Information : 


Our Company proudly provides equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants. We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process.

Flexiti is one of Canada’s fastest growing fintech lenders. We aim to make our customers’ lives more affordable and help our retail partners grow their sales by offering flexible financing options. Through our award-winning omni-channel platform, customers can be approved instantly to shop with their FlexitiCard®, which they can use online or in-store to make multiple purchases, within their credit limit, without needing to reapply.




At Flexiti, we work hard, we love what we do, and we have some fun along the way! If you are looking for an energizing and innovative work environment with great people and big ideas, we’d love to have you join us!




To learn more about Flexiti, please visit www.flexiti.com





This position is remote capable within Canada or Argentina.



 



Software Engineering Manager, Product Operations


Flexiti Financial is looking for a Software Engineering Manager to join its IT team. Supporting the Director of Software Engineering, the Software Engineering Manager will manage all the activities of the Product Operations group; sets attainable goals to team members for the project to be finished on time; identifies and leads opportunities to improve team productivity; and is technical thought leader on the team.





What you will be doing:



Develop, manage, and support a high performing development team

Guide, coach, and mentor software development engineers

Manage overall software development lifecycle

Provide project management expertise to create, prioritize, communicate project plans, and commitments

Report on status of development, quality, operations and system performance to management

Supervise architecture plus lead efforts to develop the best technical design and approach

Foster a culture of continuous engineering improvement through mentoring, feedback, and metrics

Hire, coach, and mentor individuals, build a strong cross-functional team

Establish and refine software development standards and processes along with best practices for delivery of scalable and high-quality software

Discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions






Why people love working here:



You have the opportunity to be a part of an award winning, fast growing company 

Our innovative culture promotes on-going learning opportunities with training and mentorship 

A new and vibrant office environment and remote working capability 

Competitive compensation package commensurate to experience plus benefits 






What you should have:



3+ years of experience leading software development teams in a managerial capacity with hands-on involvement in architecture, design, and performance

3+ years of people management experience

5+ years of relevant engineering experience

Software development background in object-oriented programming, distributed systems, .Net (preferred) or Java, JavaScript, Angular, NodeJS Express, SQL Server, Mongo, Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)

Experience with Unit Testing, Development patterns and CI/CD

Ability to support each lifecycle phase with hands-on contribution and ownership

Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or in Software Engineering

Excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate clearly with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels

Experience with MuleSoft is an asset






Flexiti embraces diversity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
