description:
Reporting to the Production Manager, the Bagger Operator will us knowledge and people skills to assist the mill in reaching optimal production targets. The Bagger Operator is expected to be able to operate the robot, stretch wrapper, forklift and assist the bagging operation. He/she is also expected to conduct all matters in a manner consistent with the company’s Corporate Values of Innovation, Caring, Capable, and Collaboration.


Job Description: 




CAREER OPPORTUNITY




_____________________________________________________________________________



 JOB TITLE: BAGGER OPERATOR 



DIVISION: West (Alberta) 



REPORTS TO: Production Manager, Chilliwack 



LOCATION: Chilliwack, BC


Trouw Nutrition is a part of Nutreco, a global leader in animal nutrition and fish feed. Quality, innovation and sustainability are guiding principles embedded in the Nutreco culture from research and raw material procurement to products and services for agriculture and aquaculture. Experience across 100 years brings Nutreco a rich heritage of knowledge and experience for building its future. Nutreco employs approximately 10,000 people in 30 countries with sales in 80 countries.


POSITION SUMMARY: 
Reporting to the Production Manager, the Bagger Operator will us knowledge and people skills to assist the mill in reaching optimal production targets. The Bagger Operator is expected to be able to operate the robot, stretch wrapper, forklift and assist the bagging operation. He/she is also expected to conduct all matters in a manner consistent with the company’s Corporate Values of Innovation, Caring, Capable, and Collaboration.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



Adhere to safety policies and procedures to minimize incidence of injury and reduce amount of recordable injuries.

Constant quality and food safety awareness and take corrective action to prevent quality issues.

Assist in meeting or exceeding production targets while maintaining safety and quality standards.

Follow assigned tasks on a shift basis.

Ensure housekeeping standards are met within assigned areas.

Troubleshoot general issues around the bagging line.

Assist in the implementation of continuous improvement projects.

Other duties as required.




PREFERRED HIRING CRITERIA:



Ability to operate the associated equipment on the bagging line.

Mechanically inclined.

Forklift certification.

Knowledge of associated bagging equipment.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Detail oriented.

Ability to work shift work.

Collaboration, coordination, multi-tasking, high learning capacity.

Ability to lift a minimum of 25 kgs.

Physical Requirements: Ability to regularly bend and twist, open and close lids, climb ladders, and lift 50 pounds.

Physical Work Conditions: Often exposed to loud sounds, distracting noise levels, and dusty environment.

Positive attitude, team player, and alignment with the Trouw / Nutreco Values – Caring, Collaborative, Capable and Innovative.




WHAT WE OFFER
:


Full-time; Shift Work Rotation; Overtime as required; Permanent; Unionized




WHAT WE OFFER
:


Base salary commensurate with experience; bonus; health care benefits, health care spending account, pension plan with employer matching.




APPLICATION PROCESS:
 If you are interested in applying for this position, please visit the careers section of our website at 
www.trouwnutrition.ca
 and submit an application by
 Friday, March 25, 2022
. We thank all applicants for their interest in Trouw Nutrition Canada Inc.; however only those selected for interviews will be contacted. No calls please. We are committed to employment equity and we encourage applications from qualified individuals, including women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. Trouw Nutrition Canada Inc. is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.


Our organisation:


Nutreco is a global leader in animal nutrition and fish feed. Our advanced nutritional solutions are at the origin of food for millions of consumers worldwide. Quality, innovation and sustainability are guiding principles, embedded in the Nutreco culture from research and raw material procurement to products and services for agriculture and aquaculture. Experience across 100 years brings Nutreco a rich heritage of knowledge and experience for building its future.


Equal Opportunity Employer: 


Nutreco is an equal opportunity employer; applicants are considered for all roles without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, military status or any other status protected by applicable local law. industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon Logistics (AMZL) Startup-Execution Team’s mission is to elevate the experience of our associates, DA’s and leaders at AMZL Delivery Stations along with launching new stations. The team coordinates and drives the on-time delivery of projects, both new launch and existing building retrofit, that exceed our customer expectations in regard to safety, quality and efficiency. As a Project manager this individual will be responsible for design planning and approval, vendor and other stakeholder group coordination, quality assurance, and customer harmonization while managing individual project budgets of up to $12M. Startup-Execution Managers are consummate problem solvers who are driven to deliver perfectly for their customers, see around corners to identify risk, and create complex solutions that have a direct impact on thousands of Amazonians and our Customers!

This role requires extreme Ownership and Customer Obsession and relies on a strong ability to Learn and Be Curious and Insist on the Highest Standards while Earning Trust to continuously improve the AMZL organization. We are comfortable challenging all aspects of the organization to ensure our projects provide the safest environment possible for associates, DAs and management teams and this role requires regular communication with senior management on project status, risk and change management. As the direct point of contact with station leadership, Project Managers are driven to understand our Customer’s business needs and identify improvement opportunities that minimize impact on site operations while delivering industry revolutionizing renovation and improvement projects. As the Voice of the Customer this imparts a huge responsibility to leave no issue unsolved and protect our customers while actively seeking feedback on where improvements will be most impactful. If you thrive in an environment where you coordinate multiple teams and projects simultaneously and are looking for the ability to have impact and influence across a huge scope, Startup-Execution could be a great fit for you!

Key job responsibilities


 Drive Customer Obsession through all activities and teams

 Earn Trust operations customers through clear and timely communication, gathering of feedback, and driving all action items to completion

 Take end-to-end ownership of everything within your grasp or scope of influence

 Assess, escalate, and eliminate project risks to safely deliver projects on-time, under budget, and within all design standards

 Follow project specific action plans maintaining and ensuring the quality of all project tasks

 Escalate and identify opportunities for new standard work and mechanisms to close gaps where guidance in action plans is unclear or incomplete

 Deploy for days and up to several weeks to various geographies within North America in order to launch the most innovative delivery solutions in the world. Travel requirement is up to 75%

 Create and implement improvements to our transportation network that deliver flexible and efficient products on behalf of our customers

 Manage on-site deployment of third party logistics vendors, managing daily workflow, budgets, inventory control and quality assurance for equipment deployment

 Lead meetings including Senior Leaders from up to 30 cross functional teams

 Work within various time constraints to meet critical business needs


A day in the life

Program Managers own three phases of project life cycle for multiple launch and renovation projects at any given time: Planning, Execution, Follow-up

Through a project’s planning phase this individual will lead calls aligning multiple teams to ensure all project milestones are being reached, confirm designs, order all equipment required for the project, and coordinate design changes and improvements to meet ever changing needs of our business.

Most projects require physical onsite presence through the final one to six weeks of the project’s execution phase. Daily activities include coordination of third-party vendor activities with teams of up to 30 people, construction team activities, inventory receipt and controls, inspection for quality and design intent of all interior equipment and furniture, building site safety and signage coordination and strong relationship building with our Operations customers to identify and address blockers to their success.

Post launch activities involve development and coordination for closeout of open punch-list items with stakeholder groups and third party vendors and programmatic improvement initiatives based on lessons learned for each project.

In addition to the above project specific work, the team is constantly building tools, mechanisms, standard works, and running development actions to enhance and improve our overall program. Program Managers influence, enhance, and take ownership of projects that innovate and align all activities to our core focus of Customer Obsessed problem solvers. The scope of this project work can impact several sites, all sites launching in a given year, or all sites in the network. This is a role with a very large scope where leaders are able to coordinate, create, and drive initiatives.



About The Team



Startup-Execution Vision: AMZL SUEX shall be the team that will relentlessly focus on improving the safety, experience and productivity of our associates/DAs and field leaders by being the voice of the field and innovating on behalf of our Customers.



Our Priorities




 Take care of our team (respect diversity, health, provide development and support)

 Our Plans will be robust to ensure we uphold the bar on Safety and Associate Experience and that operational disruption is minimized.

 Create Quality Assurance – Know the Plan! Collaborate and align with internal customers and stakeholders around all programs, utilizing mechanisms as defined within project structure.

 Apply Quality Control – Nail the plan! Achieve 100% first pass yield, with no “go backs”, utilizing audit mechanisms including commissioning, customer feedback generated improvements, and strict adherence and discipline to our action plans.





Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor’s Degree and 2+ peaks of experience or 3 years of progressive Amazon experience with proven advancement of scope and management or relevant management and project/program manager experience

 2+ years demonstrable problem-solving, mathematics, and analytical skills using data to drive decisions in a business environment




Preferred Qualifications




 Bachelors in Engineering, Production Management or MBA

 5+ years of progressive responsibility in program or project management or operations leadership

 Experience as a startup or launch program manager or as a process deployment program manager

 Experience with the design and utilization of complex systems

 Project Management certification

 Experience working with project management tools

 Experience driving successful partnerships with cross-functional leadership to execute strategic initiatives and develop strategic roadmaps

 Written and verbal communication skills

 Experience with complex and creative problem solving and the desire to create and build new processes

 Experience in leadership when confronted with difficult situations exhibiting ability to keep the team focused and motivated

 Experience with building relationships

 Experience working in a dynamic, deadline-oriented work environment

 Presentation and negotiation skills


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

description:
Ketler Farms is a joint venture operation with Nature Fresh Farms Inc. It is a 30-acre state-of-the art greenhouse facility that is committed to quality vegetable production. We are seeking a committed Human Resources Health & Safety Generalist with initiative and drive to manage all aspects Ketler Farms Human Resources and Health and Safety responsibilities.





Job Overview


Reporting to the Operational Manager, the Human Resources Health & Safety Generalist provides a full range of Human Resources and Health & Safety support to management and employees. The HR & HS Generalist is solely responsible for Human Resources and Health & Safety duties that support our company objectives, including but not limited to recruitment processes, employee development and training, Worker Awareness, Occupational Health and Safety program, facility inspections, investigations and WSIB responsibilities.





Job Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:



Comply with federal, provincial, and local legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation with respect to Human Resources and Health and Safety, anticipating new or updated legislation, enforcing adherence to requirements, and advising management on required actions.

Create and implement HR and H&S policies and procedures and provide support and guidance with interpretation of such policies.

Assist with the development and administration of programs, procedures, and guidelines to help align the workforce with the strategic goals of the company.

Create, review, update and ensure compliance with HR and HS policies, procedures, and SOP’s

Manage recruitment processes including advertising, interviewing, and drafting new hire agreements.

Oversee onboarding of new hires including employee set up, orientations, H&S training and training plans.

Maintain company benefits administration

Assist with employee inquiries and complaints, reporting incidents, conduct investigations and meet with managers to determine effective remediation techniques.

Provides guidance in identifying, evaluating, and resolving human relations and work related or performance challenges to facilitate communication and improve employee relations and work performance.

Guide and assist management and supervisors through the progressive discipline process.

Coordinate performance reviews, assist with compensation review process

Prepare employee separation notices and related documentation and conduct exit interviews to determine reasons behind separations.

Responsible for maintaining job descriptions, employee files, policies, employee notices, employee communication boards and Health & Safety boards

Manage and coordinate all Occupational Health and Safety Programs and training including but not limited to Worker’s Awareness, Emergency Response, Lockout Tagout and Accident Reporting.

Conduct Emergency, Occupational and Non – Occupational accident investigations and if required complete WSIB reporting within deadlines, implement corrective actions, formulate and assist with return-to-work plans requiring modified duties.

Liaise with WSIB, Ministry of Labour and any other government agencies as a representative for the company.

Mediate employee complaints and or work refusals.

Conduct routine facility and safety equipment inspections and evaluate compliance to the company’s safety programs.

Actively initiate, participate in and support continuous improvement initiatives

Reporting as required by management






Job Requirements:



2+ years progressive experience in a Human Resources Generalist Role or Health & Safety role is an asset

A post-secondary education relating to Human Resources and/or Business Administration/Business Management would be an asset

Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to develop and maintain relationships of trust with individuals at all levels of the organization

Proficient with Microsoft 365 applications

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, must be a good team player.

Strong problem-solving skills required to analyze/solve problems and any unforeseen complications that could arise.

Proven track record with seeing jobs/projects through to completion while meeting deadlines.

Must be able to prioritize and multi-task while having strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Ability to manage sensitive and confidential information with tact and discretion

Flexibility to work on weekends/after hours and on- call if needed.

Valid drivers license and personal vehicle are required.

Willingness to learn and grow in the position.






Compensation: based on experience



﻿


If you are interested in this exciting opportunity and want to join our dynamic team, we encourage you to send your resume by email or through Indeed. We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.






Ketler Farms Inc. is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, beginning with the hiring process. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcome applications from candidates, in accordance with all relevant legislation. Ketler Farms provides an accessible environment in which all individuals have access in a way that respects the dignity and independence of people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

industries: Machinery Manufacturing, Retail, and Truck Transportation

description:
Note: The following is an opportunity for flexible, part-time, volunteer work. Please DO NOT APPLY if you are looking for paid employment only. All positions are remote/ work-from-home.



WhoWhatWhy is seeking a program manager to oversee our team of embedded project managers across different functions within the organization. Our Project Management Office (PMO) is a new addition to our organization, so this is a critical role to help the PMO introduce new systems and best practices to existing project managers, as well as onboard new ones. The ideal candidate will have experience working in digital content production, and a track record of working cross-functionally with other departments, such as operations, marketing, research, technology, and more.

Are you an experienced program manager with a background in news publishing or non-profits who wants to make a difference? Do you want to work with smart and talented people to produce great journalism in the public interest? Can you commit 10 hours a week working remotely on your own schedule? Are you looking for an exciting challenge and an opportunity for leadership experience? Join our diverse and values-driven team of students, retirees, and everyone in between from across the globe.

WhoWhatWhy.org is the operating arm of Real News Project, Inc., a global non-profit news organization committed to rigorous journalism, unbound by corporate interest, a political agenda, or search-engine algorithms. Our mission is to deliver fact-based, objective news with contextual analysis to help the public understand a fast-changing, complex world.

We launched with the idea of delivering to the public the courageous and thorough investigations into powerful institutions, entities, and individuals that shape our world, it deserves. We support traditional journalism, but this grave moment in time calls for a stronger response — a journalism more urgent and ambitious. We pride ourselves on having no sacred cows and covering stories that no one else will touch. At WhoWhatWhy, we believe that quality information changes everything.

We do not accept ads and we are not underwritten by a wealthy benefactor. We operate independently and leanly through our unique staffing model: Based on public contributions, we pay a core management team and professional freelance writers — and support with a large infrastructure of dedicated volunteers. WhoWhatWhy is a non-hierarchical organization that fully relies upon individual ingenuity and initiative. We pair newcomers with veterans to help them develop the skills and leadership traits required for the challenging and evolving news landscape.


Responsibilities



Manage a team of volunteer project managers across several functions in the WhoWhatWhy organization.

Ensure projects are being completed in a timely, budget-specific fashion at all times.

Report on the health of projects within the PMO to our governing committee on a regular basis.

Serve as an escalation point for team members and project managers when things do not go as planned, and provide direction to resolve issues and clear blockers.

Collaborate with the PMO lead and manager to implement a new project management system and introduce a comprehensive list of PMO best practices.

Seek out opportunities for continuous process improvement across the PMO practice.




Minimum Qualifications



5-7 years experience as a program manager or a senior project manager who has regularly overseen a large portfolio of projects

Experience building a team of project managers

Direct experience working with creative teams and across cross-functional business units

Proven track record of establishing reporting methods and communication plans

Impeccable written and verbal communication skills




Preferred Qualifications



Prior experience setting up a project management practice or PMO within an organization a major plus



Perks


Channel your passion in a stimulating environment.

Learn the nuts and bolts of non-profit operations in an up-and-coming organization.

Develop new skills and gain valuable experience that can enhance your professional trajectory.

Do amazing work on a flexible, part-time basis.

Have fun while you make a difference.



Expectations

You will be expected to attend your department’s recurring meetings. Beyond this, you will work on your own schedule. We ask for a minimum commitment of six months for at least 10 hours a week. Because our team is spread throughout the world, we rely on a combination of Slack, email, and conference calls, and expect everyone to be responsive in a timely manner.

To Apply

We will not review applications that appear to be mass submissions. To apply, send your resume and a customized cover letter, making clear you are familiar with our mission and work. You should confirm your understanding that this is a volunteer position. If there is no option to attach a cover letter, please send a cover letter to hr@whowhatwhy.org.

Please note that response emails from us sometimes end up in spam folders; don’t forget to check them. Thank you!

description:
The Effects Supervisor plays an integral role in the production team. They will supervise and review the creation of show based effects elements. They will supervise a team of artists, and work with the Production Designer and Head of Effects Animation to realize the Director’s vision. This is a regular, full time, staff position that will be located at our Vancouver, BC studio. Please note that relocation eligibility may be determined based on role and individual circumstance.


Responsibilities : 



Role Specifics




Collaborate with the Head of Effects Animation and other departments to facilitate the development and execution of show effects.

Work closely with the other departments to achieve the desired look and integration of rendered effects.

Be “on the floor” to help with production related questions other artists may have.

May be responsible for taking lead on developing and packaging a major effect on the project.

Follow up with artists after casting and dailies to answer any questions and check the progress of scenes/elements.


Implementation




Responsible for consumability and efficiency of artist deliverables into downstream departments. 

Participates in department processes, bidding, and reviews.

Assesses resource needs and collaborates with department leadership in helping find staffing solutions. 


Leading People




Creates an inclusive and safe work environment by carefully managing sensitive information, making rooms feel open and comfortable, creating space for everyone to have a voice, and addressing bias when it occurs. 

Guides the creative and technical vision/expectations for the team members. 

In tight conjunction with the Head of Effects Animation, Production Management, and Department Manager, inspires and motivates the team. 

Contributes to the overall craft and development of team members through setting expectations, delivering consistent constructive feedback, recognition, and accountability. 


Collaboration




Models and fosters a collaborative work environment between individuals on the team and across departments. 

Identifies solutions and compromises in partnership with other supervisors


Communication




Provides regular updates to direct leaders on the progress, health, and direction of the team. 

Keeps the team informed with context for show related changes and updates. 


Studio Stewardship




Studio Culture- Actively fosters an inclusive, innovative, and collaborative environment so every employee can contribute at the highest levels. 

Technology, Tools, and Workflow- Engages in the creation and execution of technical standards, pipeline conventions, and workflows to support the department, show, and studio.

Department Stewardship- Partners closely with peers and Department Manager support an environment of creativity, trust, and innovation. Actively involved in assessment, casting, hiring, and overall growth of artists. 




Basic Qualifications : 


Minimum 2 years of leadership experience that demonstrates a strong ability to lead and mentor others.

Experience as an Effects Supervisor, Sequence Supervisor, CG Supervisor, or similar role in CG Animation.

Ability to quickly learn and adapt to WDAS standards, pipeline, tools and workflows as they relate to the discipline you would be leading. 

Understanding of the disciplines/craft which they would be leading.

Proficiency with fluid simulations, rigid simulations, particle systems, and FX pipeline authorship using procedural animation techniques.

Ability to work in a collaborative environment, and take as well as give direction with tact.

Strong knowledge and technical understanding of the effects and studio pipeline.

Strong understanding of animation fundamentals, including timing, and appeal.

Good eye toward light, color, design, and composition. Observation skills of natural phenomena, comprehension of physics, and ability to implement.

Bachelor's degree or higher in Art, Illustration, Traditional (hand drawn) or Computer Animation, Cinema Studies, Computer Graphics, Engineering or equivalent experience.

 Strong knowledge of each of the following technical areas:


SideFX Houdini®

Effects and Simulation principles

The Unix/Linux environment

Python scripting

File management systems


Skill in the following areas is desired:


Traditional drawing, painting, design and/or sculpture

Knowledge of anatomy, kinematics and physical behaviors




Additional Information : 


Our Company proudly provides equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants. We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process.

industries: Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality
description:
Description




Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible. 



Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day. 



Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. 

The vaccine must be a 

two-dose COVID-19 

vaccination series approved by Health Canada

.
 
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.




Mission



The Dietary Supervisor effectively applies Revera’s person centered care philosophy with overall responsibility for the food services of a site from ordering, preparation and delivery of all meals and nourishment to the residents. Following organizational guiding principles along with the provincial and long term care regulations, the Dietary Manager provides leadership and support to the food service team to ensure a streamlined pleasurable dining experience for residents.



Key Responsibilities




 Reports to the Dietary Manager

 Prepare and/or supervise the preparation and service of all meals and nourishments following specified menus and standardized recipes

 Consult with Registered Dietitian and create specialized menus/allergy menus

 Assist the Administrator/Executive Director to ensure that the facility-wide inter-disciplinary Quality Assurance CQI Program is implemented & ongoing as well as risk management programs

 Purchase, receive, store, and control departmental supplies which may include inventory controls

 Implement seasonal and ethnic menus as required

 Ensure compliance with all provincial/long term care regulations and established Revera requirements

 Assist in Union matters related to grievance procedures, labour management relations, and contract negotiations

 Recruit, orient, supervise, delegate tasks, and evaluate the performance of the dietary staff

 Support interdisciplinary team in development / evaluation of resident care plans;

 Monitor and document resident’s nutritional status, and council residents or family members as necessary on therapeutic diets and modified textures

 Maintain operational records as required. (i.e.: menus, production charts, food and refrigeration temperatures)

 Chair the Resident's Dining Committee/Resident’s Food Council meetings and ensure satisfaction with meals; engage Activation Manager / Residents on these needs

 Work co-operatively with the health care team in preparation for accreditation;

 Work with and respond to Regulatory bodies/ Public Health

 Know & promote Resident Bill of Rights Governing Principles

 Ensure proper usage, maintenance and supply of all kitchen related equipment




Required Education, Credentials And Experience




 Minimum (2) year community college Food Services Supervisor course or equivalent

 Valid Food Safety/Food Handler’s Certification

 Member of the Canadian Society of Nutrition Management or a Registered Dietitian

 Minimum of three (3) years of relevant dietary experience and one (1) year of leadership experience, preferably in long term care

 Red Seal designation or equivalent considered an asset

 Knowledge of Provincial Food Premises Regulation, CCHSA Accreditation Canada, Health & Safety Act and Long Term Care Act

 Knowledge of nutritional needs for long term care residents including therapeutic, texture modified and ethnic diets

 Valid Vulnerable Sector Search (within 6 months)



Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request. 



Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

job_title: Operations Program Manager II, AWS Commerce Platform- Global Business Operations
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


AWS has the most services and more features within those services, than any other cloud provider–from infrastructure technologies like compute, storage, and databases–to emerging technologies, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, data lakes and analytics, and Internet of Things. AWS Platform is the glue that holds the AWS ecosystem together. Whether its Identity features such as access management and sign on, cryptography, console, builder & developer tools, and even projects like automating all of our contractual billing systems, AWS Platform is always innovating with the customer in mind. The AWS Platform team sustains over 750 million transactions per second.

Do you get excited working on new challenges every day? Do you like to problem solve, drive solutions and influence what features should be launched for customers? AWS Business Operations team is looking for an Operations Program Manager that supports accurate financial processing on Amazon platform technologies. In this position, you will manage projects in the financial space, support monthly accounting and reporting processes, and participate in new business launches. This role requires excellent communication and organization skills, including the ability to anticipate, identify and communicate risks to accounting, finance, businesses and technical teams. You must be able to work independently, remain flexible with the ability to prioritize workloads, and maintain a strong attention to detail in a fast-paced environment.

Key job responsibilities


 Lead Improvement Projects/Kaizen events to bring together cross-functional teams to identify opportunities and achieve targeted performance improvement in a compressed timeframe.

 Support monthly accounting and reporting processes

 Assess process improvement and transformation opportunities, and partner with process owners and stakeholders to scope opportunities, define problem statements and objectives, and structure projects and teams.

 Build high-quality, standardized processes that consistently deliver intended outcomes, optimize efficiency, drive automation efforts, and develop best practices.

 Provide day to day resolution to tier 3 escalations and help stakeholders in making right decisions.

 Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations.

 Remain flexible to changing priorities, open to new ideas, and have Amazon's success firmly in your focus.




About The Team



Work/Life Balance

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your manager can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Learn and Be Curious. We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your manager can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Inclusion and Diversity. Our team is diverse! We drive towards an inclusive culture and work environment. We are intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Team members are active in Amazon’s 10+ affinity groups, sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. These range from groups such as the Black Employee Network, Latinos at Amazon, Indigenous at Amazon, Families at Amazon, Amazon Women and Engineering, LGBTQ+, Warriors at Amazon (Military), Amazon People With Disabilities, and more.

Learn more about Amazon on our Day 1 Blog: https://blog.aboutamazon.com




Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor's degree

 3+ years in finance or a related field

 Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements

 3+ years of project management experience

 Experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams

 Ability to analyze data, understand trends and make recommendations based on your findings




Preferred Qualifications




 CPA (or equivalent)

 PMP (or equivalent)

 Experience in e-Commerce payments processing

 Experience working with a fast-paced and complex company

 Customer Service background

 Great organizational skills and attention to detail; able to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously

 Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate technical information to internal and external customers or vendors

 Proactive and forward-thinking attitude and creative problem-solving ability

 A motivated self-starter who can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

job_title: Manager Strategy & Program Delivery - Supply Chain
description:
Strategy & Performance Delivery Manager

Be a part of a revolutionary change!

At Rothmans Benson & Hedges (RBH), subsidiary of Philip Morris International, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future.

Wherever you join our Operations team, you’ll have the opportunity to make an impact. RBH’s shift from selling combustible products to our new non combusted alternatives is changing the way we work. New products bring new challenges – in the way we source and buy raw materials, in the way we engineer and manufacture, and in our supply chain planning.

Bring us your curiosity and a desire to challenge the everyday, and we’ll give you lots of responsibility. You’ll help us improve, inject innovation and create new ways of working. You’ll be solving supply chain problems that span the whole world a smoke-free world.

Your ‘day to day’

Lead and coordinate deployment of a wide range of projects, initiatives that are integral part of the Operations Customer Service - OCS (Supply Chain) Strategy in the local market. Such include but not limited to Masterplan/90 Day Plan, Customer collaboration projects, Product launches, various Process and Networks assessments and other program-based goals.

Collaborate with peers in the market, region and global to understand and adapt the regional and global programs to market specifics. Translate broad corporate OCS strategies into clear, specific objectives and plans for units and individuals in the E2E Supply Chain. Build plans that address specific segments or contrasts local market with other locations or regions. Manage market OCS performance targets (KPIs adherence).

Role Accountabilities


 Ensure market performance strategies are aligned to global and regional strategies.

 Collaborate locally as well as regionally & globally at all levels for implementation of OCS programs/initiatives. Prepare holistic transition plans with focus on change management and corresponding capability gap assessment plan.

 Coordinate regional efforts of different project deployments and regional initiatives.

 Establish and facilitate the governance mechanism for leading the key OCS projects/programs using the existing governance model and make improvements as required. Setup and lead SteerCos as required. Present to MT and above the progress.

 Drive the continuous improvement across the entire supply chain processes. Lead the governance for efficiency initiatives & act as a single point of contact for different initiatives.

 Act as performance lead. Facilitate and enhance the implementation of regular reporting and KPI's related to budget, cost control and process performance for all Customer Services processes as elements of the total control of the operation.

 Improve organization efficiency and help to build people capabilities by introducing new processes, structures based on evolving business and organizational requirements (e.g. downstream visibility, DRP, OTIF/Case fill rate, network optimization, RTM).

 Implement standards working procedures, operating guidelines & systems in relations to initiatives and programs. Set clear expectations, track critical milestones and focus on performance.

 Lead key market projects as new product introductions (NPI), DRP, and other strategic programs. Support the external customer facing function deployment.


Education & Experience

Bachelor’s Degree / Industrial Engineer/Consultant or similar

Experience in strategic Supply Chain Program Delivery roles and/ or corporate strategy.

Experience in driving large scale cross-functional transformation with portfolio management methodologies.

Experience implementing continues improvement systems and agile project management.

Previous experience at a best-in-class management consulting firm or global CPG/FMCG will be considered as an asset.

Experience driving senior management alignment and buy-in.

Highly collaborative -establishes collaborative and positive relationships with the business’s key leaders and partners.

Proficient English (written and spoken).

What we offer

Our success depends on the men and women who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join RBH and you too can


 Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to try new things, experiment and explore.

 Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.

 Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills– our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.

 Take pride in delivering our promise to society to improve the lives of a billion smokers.

 To join our growing team.


At RBH, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building

Reporting to the Sr Operations Manager, Planning and Inventory, the Operations Manager, Inventory is responsible for monitoring and reporting on inventory levels at SSENSE fulfillment center in Montreal. He/She will compile and analyze reports, provide insights and recommendations on inventory management, optimize business rules, lead projects to improve operational processes and delegate tasks to the inventory and stock operators..




RESPONSIBILITIES





Inventory management (30%)





Analyze and review daily/weekly/monthly/yearly reports and identify imbalances while controlling inventory level and shrinkage across multiple locations

Perform regular stock reconciliation, identify and resolve inventory mismatches

Analyze root causes of inventory issues, suggest solutions and lead projects to correct and prevent inventory discrepancies

Create, maintain and communicate KPI dashboards and reports related to stock and allocation performance

Maintain and manage the inventory capacity planning, and suggest ideas and theories to improve storage capacity and cubic feet utilization

Liaise with cross-functional stakeholders to collect data required for inventory analysis and reports

Submit storage solution requirements by analyzing seasonal inventory trends

Report to Senior Management regularly and provide recommendations for better inventory management and control

Perform other reports and analysis requirements as needed



Inventory projects and processes (30%)





Champion the execution of inventory projects as part of the Distribution Center roadmap, including location audits, activity-based cycle counts, inventory consolidation and bin quality improvements among others

Support warehouse process optimization by suggesting new processes (putaway strategies, picking waves, inventory ‘slotting’, etc.)

Define and implement seasonal allocation strategies by analyzing trends, stock usage and incoming goods

Implement and perform audit procedures to increase inventory and location accuracy and bin quality

Analyze, document and implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for inventory management

Work with cross-functional stakeholders to implement operational projects and/or processes

Perform analytical analysis to identify, lead and implement continuous improvement projects

Foster a culture of continuous improvement in all areas and instill the principles of this culture



Workflow organization (20%)





Promote a safe, organized and clean work environment following 5S

Ensure the adherence to health and safety procedures within the department

Provide direction and leadership to the team to manage daily work workflow and ensure compliance to all operation metrics and service level agreements

Monitor and report departmental performance indicators for all processes

Maintaining and improve the knowledge base through standard, concise and relevant documentation

Implement scalable processes, procedures and systems to drive operational excellence

Develop the internal processes (i.e. database inputs and reporting) to measure and report on KPIs

Approve overtime and labor cost exceptions to meet set budget requirements

Confirm and resolve issues with root cause analysis to identify performance gaps and corrective action

Develop training manuals and implement training procedure

Ensure operational budget is maintained and adhered to

Collaborate with cross-functional departments (Customer Experience, Personal Shopping, Logistics) within and outside the distribution center to ensure the best customer experience



People leadership (20%)





Provide leadership and guidance to hire, coach, motivate, lead, and retain a performance-driven team 

Lead hiring efforts and conduct internal interviews in partnership with the department manager to attract and retain top talent within the department

Oversee the on-boarding and training programs for all levels of the team

Support in the creation and development of training documentation for the team

Hold weekly one-on-ones, conduct performance reviews, analyze individual KPIs and assess promotion readiness to help each contributor evolve in their roles

Ensure team mobilization by regularly gauging team spirit and implementing appropriate means to create a work environment that fosters healthy communication, collaboration and productivity

Establish team goals and monitor team's progress towards achieving objectives




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain and Logistics Management, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field, Master’s degree an asset

A minimum of 5 years experience in inventory management and/or data analysis 

A minimum of 3 years experience managing a team

Strong knowledge of warehousing and supply chain environments

Experience in a high volume, fast pace environment an asset

Experience in an automated distribution center an asset

Advanced skills in working with data visualization tools such as Tableau or similar data discovery and visualization tools

Knowledge of key inventory performance metrics 

Excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Word)

Knowledge of SQL and databases (MySQL, Oracle, etc.) and process mapping software (Lucidchart, Visio, etc.)

Excellent English & French written and verbal communication skills, 



SKILLS





Highly analytical and detail oriented

Capacity to synthesize and simplify complex information

Capacity to work autonomously and within a team

Demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking skills

Ability to prioritize and handle multiple simultaneous assignments
