About Toptal



Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

We are looking for an organized, adaptable, and experienced Creative Operations Project Manager to support our Brand Experience division of the Creative team. Reporting to the Creative Operations Lead, you will be responsible for planning and managing all incoming or proactive campaigns assigned to the Brand Experience team. You will own the creative process and manage the end-to-end development and execution of the team’s projects. You will be working closely with our Creative Directors and other team leads to balance the needs of the creative team with the requirements and expectations of cross teams.

As the Creative Operations Project Manager, you will communicate weekly updates and reports to the team on the projects that are missing critical information, overdue or behind schedule, or otherwise impacted. We are looking for someone who is organized and a professional self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic and collaborative environment.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.



Responsibilities




Serve as primary contact and oversee complex creative projects including top of funnel campaigns, 360 creative ad campaigns, video content, social content, and much more, across all of our channels.

Create project plans, roadmaps, and campaign timelines for the Brand Experience team against all of the team’s projects. Document and maintain process flows between the Brand Experience team and the stakeholders to deliver strategically on-brief, compelling on-Brand creative, within an allotted time frame.

With the Creative Operations Lead, manage the Brand Experience team’s weekly intake process, help vet and assign projects based on priorities and bandwidth. Optimize our processes to improve the overall efficiency of the Brand Experience team.

Lead weekly meetings to communicate and track the status of each deliverable and make sure there’s proper documentation of all projects.

Efficiently and effectively manage day-to-day problems, and communicate effectively in difficult and time-sensitive situations. Understand when (and why) to escalate issues to Creative Ops Lead.

Partner with Traffic Manager to push the Brand Experience’s team projects through our project management tool.

Experience with working with project management tools (i.e. Asana, Jira) is a plus.




In The First Week, Expect To




Get the lay of the land and have a lot of Zoom coffees.

Start to meet with the team leads.

Understand the fundamentals of Toptal and what sets us apart.

Onboard and integrate into Toptal by gaining an understanding of our brand strategy, guidelines, messaging, and governance processes.

Gain a deep understanding of the roles and priorities of the team and key partners.




In The First Month, Expect To




Be able to read and understand the briefs coming in.

Be comfortable creating a timeline for each project.

Set up kick-off meetings for the team and take meeting notes.

Hold weekly status meetings with Brand Experience teams.




In The First Three Months, Expect To




Proactively, efficiently, and independently manage multiple projects.

Understand and manage projects on our project management tools.




In The First Six Months, Expect To




Identify areas of improvement in the workflow.

Be able to plan timelines for multiple projects for each quarter.

Help put together an onboarding process for future Creative Operations Project Managers.




In The First Year, Expect To




Take a critical look at the process, streamline and optimize it.

Identify clear ways to improve team efficiency.

Continue to take on additional responsibilities.




Requirements




3+ years of traffic or project management experience with an advertising agency, design studio, creative department, or related environment.

Ability to multitask, set priorities, and be resourceful in a fast-paced environment.

Comfort with deadlines and last-minute requests, with a clear understanding of how to prioritize work.

Proficiency with project management tools such as Welcome, Trello, Asana, Monday, etc.

Excellent communication skills and ability to clearly articulate requirements; Highly responsive.

Organized, detail-oriented, stays cool under pressure, and relationship builder.

You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.


For Toptal Use Only: #west #midwest #ussouth #northeast #southamerica #canada

About Toptal



Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

We are looking for an organized, adaptable, and experienced Creative Operations Project Manager to support our Brand Experience division of the Creative team. Reporting to the Creative Operations Lead, you will be responsible for planning and managing all incoming or proactive campaigns assigned to the Brand Experience team. You will own the creative process and manage the end-to-end development and execution of the team’s projects. You will be working closely with our Creative Directors and other team leads to balance the needs of the creative team with the requirements and expectations of cross teams.

As the Creative Operations Project Manager, you will communicate weekly updates and reports to the team on the projects that are missing critical information, overdue or behind schedule, or otherwise impacted. We are looking for someone who is organized and a professional self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic and collaborative environment.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.



Responsibilities




Serve as primary contact and oversee complex creative projects including top of funnel campaigns, 360 creative ad campaigns, video content, social content, and much more, across all of our channels.

Create project plans, roadmaps, and campaign timelines for the Brand Experience team against all of the team’s projects. Document and maintain process flows between the Brand Experience team and the stakeholders to deliver strategically on-brief, compelling on-Brand creative, within an allotted time frame.

With the Creative Operations Lead, manage the Brand Experience team’s weekly intake process, help vet and assign projects based on priorities and bandwidth. Optimize our processes to improve the overall efficiency of the Brand Experience team.

Lead weekly meetings to communicate and track the status of each deliverable and make sure there’s proper documentation of all projects.

Efficiently and effectively manage day-to-day problems, and communicate effectively in difficult and time-sensitive situations. Understand when (and why) to escalate issues to Creative Ops Lead.

Partner with Traffic Manager to push the Brand Experience’s team projects through our project management tool.

Experience with working with project management tools (i.e. Asana, Jira) is a plus.




In The First Week, Expect To




Get the lay of the land and have a lot of Zoom coffees.

Start to meet with the team leads.

Understand the fundamentals of Toptal and what sets us apart.

Onboard and integrate into Toptal by gaining an understanding of our brand strategy, guidelines, messaging, and governance processes.

Gain a deep understanding of the roles and priorities of the team and key partners.




In The First Month, Expect To




Be able to read and understand the briefs coming in.

Be comfortable creating a timeline for each project.

Set up kick-off meetings for the team and take meeting notes.

Hold weekly status meetings with Brand Experience teams.




In The First Three Months, Expect To




Proactively, efficiently, and independently manage multiple projects.

Understand and manage projects on our project management tools.




In The First Six Months, Expect To




Identify areas of improvement in the workflow.

Be able to plan timelines for multiple projects for each quarter.

Help put together an onboarding process for future Creative Operations Project Managers.




In The First Year, Expect To




Take a critical look at the process, streamline and optimize it.

Identify clear ways to improve team efficiency.

Continue to take on additional responsibilities.




Requirements




3+ years of traffic or project management experience with an advertising agency, design studio, creative department, or related environment.

Ability to multitask, set priorities, and be resourceful in a fast-paced environment.

Comfort with deadlines and last-minute requests, with a clear understanding of how to prioritize work.

Proficiency with project management tools such as Welcome, Trello, Asana, Monday, etc.

Excellent communication skills and ability to clearly articulate requirements; Highly responsive.

Organized, detail-oriented, stays cool under pressure, and relationship builder.

You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.


For Toptal Use Only: #west #midwest #ussouth #northeast #southamerica #canada

About Us



Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!


Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, evian® and A&W®.


About This Opportunity


Dispatchers are responsible for planning and distributing driver delivery routes, maximizing delivery efficiencies and driver safety through proper load distribution. This position will be based out of our Brampton facility.


Shifts starting at 5:30 PM, Monday to Friday, 8 hour shifts. 



This is a 12 months contract position.



Responsibilities



Responsible for planning and distributing sales orders into profitable delivery loads ensuring efficient resource utilization

Maximize delivery efficiencies and driver safety through proper load distribution 

Check order files for accuracy and make corrections

Process returns for re-delivery 

Maintain Master Data for LEO Dispatch

Communicate with sales centers to ensure delivery efficiencies

Location Notes updated quarterly for: Overnight Sequencing, Fleet on Hand, DC Contacts




Qualifications



High School Diploma or GED required

Bachelor's degree in Production Operations Management or Supply Chain preferred.

3 or more years of experience in area of Supply Chain or Sales Operations experience preferred. DSD Dispatch/Planning experience is an asset

Merchandising/Distribution supervision or sales operations account management (RAR or Account Manager).

Route planning or dispatching

3 or more years of relevant or related consumer products supply chain experience





Important



All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regards to this once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com .

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

Lead & manage large, complex marketing projects to keep them, and us, organized, on schedule and on budget.At Nexus, we are all about Connecting People with Purpose. We build culture for our client organizations. We facilitate people growing their careers. We help companies connect with their people in more meaningful, authentic, and impactful ways.Specifically, our communications work spans across our clients’ ‘employee experience’ - from talent attraction, to orientation & on-boarding, values and culture, pay & benefits, leadership, learning/training, engagement & recognition, and beyond. We are a full spectrum communications firm, developing targeted strategy, insightful content, and outstanding creative work for all platforms, from traditional media to video, digital, podcasts, e-learning and more.This position is a challenging and highly satisfying opportunity for someone who thrives on keeping organized and on-track - remaining calm, cool, and collected when dealing with competing priorities.We are looking for a highly organized, process-oriented project manager to play a lead role in delivering optimized and seamless experiences, for our clients and internal teams. These goals extend to all phases of complex, multifaceted learning, and culture communications projects, targeting key stakeholder groups: executives, people leaders, individual contributors._______________ Job DescriptionWorking with our internal production and account teams, you will help bring our clients’ large-scale employee-facing programs to life. Your contributions will ensure seamless development and delivery of creative materials and impactful communications materials in multiple formats: Web, video, presentation, interactive learning, PDF, posters, digital ads, etc. Your efforts will include:Full project life cycle ownership for complex, omni-channel programs which can include Video, Digital/Web, Internal/External Communication & Learning projects, Paid Media etc.Keeping team members focused on project goals, their functional responsibilities and project milestones by acting as the main point of contact for project status. This includes coordinating with multiple stakeholders (internal and external) to provide leadership for all aspects of project engagement - from planning, stakeholder communications, scope documentation, resourcing, scheduling, budget tracking, financial controls, change order management, quality control and risk management.Work with and provide support to optimize Nexus’ project management system, (FunctionPoint) and related policies & processes. Evolve project management tools and templates to foster an environment of continuous improvement.Participate and/or lead production meetings, daily scrums, internal and client-facing calls.Develop and deliver comprehensive, formal scheduled (day/week/month and/or quarter) status reporting, as required. ATTRIBUTES:YOU ARE a creative problem solver, influencer, and change manager, with excellent communications skills, a positive attitude, and the ability to inspire. These attributes will enable you to negotiate and influence key participants at various levels and in various geographies, while influencing positive change through awareness, understanding, acceptance and engagement with key project milestones.YOU CAN demonstrate leadership and project/program management experience by providing examples of successful completion of multiple cross-functional, cross-business, and cross-cultural projects.Your capabilities include:Professional, clear, confident verbal & written communication abilities;Ability to work independently and/or effectively with diverse, cross organizational teams;You are highly adaptable and comfortable interacting with all levels of client and internal organizations;You have an innate ability to influence, negotiate and work with people wherever they may be.Requirements Minimum 3-5 years relevant Project Management experience in marketing and/or communications - client or agency side.Experience in omni-channel communications (interactive, video, traditional, paid media) is preferred.Excellent working knowledge of MS-Project is preferred.Experience in MS Office - Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel & Word.Knowledge of Human Resources, internal/corporate communications and B2B are strong assets.PMP certified or working towards certification is preferred.If you are confident and enthusiastic with a proactive approach to project management and program leadership, and looking for interesting work with purpose, your efforts will contribute to making a difference for a lot of people.Please submitA short cover letter highlighting your relevant experienceYour resumeNexus Communications is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace.



Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

At Clorox, we champion people to be well and thrive by doing the right thing, putting people at the center, and playing to win. Led by our IGNITE strategy, we build brands that make a positive difference in people’s lives around the world. And we know that success requires head, heart, AND guts — all three, every day — coming together to work simpler, faster, bolder, and more inclusively. Interested? Join us to #IgniteYourCareer!


Your role at Clorox:


What an exciting time to join a winning team where you will get to lead cultural transformation! This role will play an instrumental role on the Plant Leadership team for GLAD and Brita to provide strategic HR direction on people processes and initiatives. This role will lead, develop and execute initiatives in support of the business and people pillar to drive a culture of agility, accountability, leadership and engagement.

The role will facilitate day to day HR Operations using a hybrid framework to support both GLAD, in Orangeville and Brita, in Brampton, non-unionized facilities and be involved in any HR project that impacts the Supply Chain operations.

Successful candidate will need to drive to both plants each week, millage is offered.


In this role, you will:


Daily Responsibilities:


Lead people initiatives to support Plant Leadership teams at two plant locations

Partner with Plant leadership teams in the implementation of people processes and organizational changes/change management

Counseling and Coaching - educate, advise, and be reachable/presence as needed.

Assurance of policies applied in a consistent way across the facilities

Onboarding on HR process for new Plant leadership teams members

Communication and Networking

Maintain communications and linkage to the HR Center and enterprise wide initiatives.

Liaise with Plant leadership teams on organizational development, recruitment, capability and training (Global Solutions and Workforce Services)

Lead communication work stream on HR processes (for changes, programs, updates, etc.)

Contribute on the HR initiatives/work streams to drive the Plants objectives

Support on key business tracking metrics (Headcount, Regrettable Turnover, Leadership and Employee satisfaction indicators, etc) the decision-making process for people processes.

Support succession and workforce planning for the two facilities

Driving HR agenda and annual people planning as needed. (monthly and quarterly reviews of all the plants, training information, changes to policies or updates on people, key human resource updates like hiring, reviews, handbook changes or organization changes, discipline.)

Participate/ lead special people, engagement and change management initiatives while fostering an inclusive and diverse work culture

Lead annual wage and compensation analysis for plant employees

Work with the Canadian People & team to provide payroll back-up and provide PSO perspective on all major initiatives, support to the team and also own the implementation of corporate initiatives into the plant environments



What we look for:


Years and Type of Experience:


Minimum 7 years HR experience

A minimum of 3 years of experience as a Plant Human Resources Manager in a Manufacturing/Operations environment is required


Skills and Abilities:


HR generalist experience in the following areas: selection and recruitment, employee grievance management to coach Managers in a preventive approach, compensation, liaison between center of excellence and shared HR resources with good interpersonal relationship skills, development and oversight of the application of policies/handbook, administration of due process

Change management and project management capabilities

Strong employee relations skills, employment and labor law knowledge

Experience with organizational design/effectiveness (work systems, organizational assessments)

Strategic thinking – process oriented

Excellent interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills; able to effectively engage with all levels of organization and internal and external audiences.

Innovative thinking with the ability to partner with manufacturing partners effectively


Education Level/Degree:


Bachelor’s Degree required

Advanced Degree in Business or HR specialty preferred.



We seek out and celebrate diverse backgrounds and experiences, and we know you don’t need a degree to succeed. We’re looking for fresh perspectives, a desire to bring your best, and a non-stop drive to keep growing and learning.



At Clorox, we have a 

Culture of Inclusion. We believe our values-based culture connects to our purpose and helps our people be the best versions of themselves, professionally and personally. This means building a workplace where every person can feel respected, valued, and fully able to participate in our Clorox community. Learn more about our I&D program & initiatives
 
here
.


Benefits we offer to help you be well and thrive:



Competitive compensation

Generous 401(k) program in the US and similar programs in international

Health benefits and programs that support both your physical and mental well-being

Flexible work environment, depending on your role

Meaningful opportunities to keep learning and growing

Half-day Fridays, depending on your location


Please apply directly to our job postings and do not submit your resume to any person via text message. Clorox does not conduct text-based interviews and encourages you to be cautious of anyone posing as a Clorox recruiter via unsolicited texts during these uncertain times.

job_title: Manager, Supply Chain Manufacturing Strategy and Smart Operations (Montreal)
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Accounting
description:
Job Type:
 Permanent


Primary Location:
 Montreal, Quebec, Canada


All Available Locations:
 Montreal


Our Purpose


At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

Experience a firm where wellness matters.

Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.

Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.


Join our Supply Chain practice! Named a leader in Supply Chain and Operations Consulting by both Gartner and Kennedy Consulting Research & Advisory.




What will your typical day look like?



Our practice has global reach and you might find yourself jumping on a flight to Montreal, Vancouver, Chicago, Hong Kong, Sweden, and many other interesting locations. Wherever it may be, you will m anage best-in-class Manufacturing assessment and transformation projects. There is also a need to use advanced analytics to drive cost reductions and performance improvement, and technology transformations with clients that come to Deloitte to help solve their pressing concerns. You will enjoy cultivating and managing relationships at the client leadership level while identifying sales opportunities and leading the development of proposals to assist clients in improving their supply chain performance. In addition, you will also coach and develop practice staff while participating in firm recruitment events.



About The Team



The Deloitte Supply Chain & Network Operations Consulting practice is the largest in the Canadian market and part of the largest consulting firm in the world and growing. We work hand-in-hand with our clients from virtually every industry to improve business performance, drive shareholder value and create competitive advantage. Our works involves developing innovative recommendations to address client issues and present the findings to senior executives. Depending on the project, we evolve this storyline into a strategic roadmap and detailed project plan for execution. Ensuring client success does not stop there. We also to collaborate with clients through the implementation to see the vision become a reality.



Enough about us, let’s talk about you



You are someone who:


 Has 6+ years of Manufacturing-related industry or consulting experience in key focus areas such as i ndustrial engineering , o perations excellence and productivity improvement (Lean/Six Sigma Black Belt is an asset). p roduction planning, finite scheduling and capacity analysis, ERP functionality, d igital manufacturing technlogies, Siemens PLM, Teamcenter applicatins; or Kinaxis planning applications (is an asset) 

 Possesses a Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Business, Engineering, or a related field, with advanced degrees preferred (e.g. MBA, MS (Supply Chain), etc.) 

 Is able to travel up to 80% of the time in Canada and the USA, and globally when required 

 Has experience leading or managing teams and change initiatives (especially in a project management role) 

 Has experience with rapid assessment and building business cases in ambiguous environments 



Our shared values


While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:


Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world. 

Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility. 

Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being. 

Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions. 

Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours


Sound like 
The One Firm. For You?
 Apply by 
[insert date]
.

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and 
the 
 BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

industries: Food and Beverage Services, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Manufacturing
description:
McCormick Canada continues its long track record of growth and is a respected leader in the spice, seasoning, flavouring and specialty food industry. Our consumer products division serves retail grocery customers and emerging channels with Club House, Billy Bee and McCormick products, while our Custom Flavour Solutions division serves food service distributors and other respected food manufacturers across Canada. McCormick Canada is part of the world leader in spice and seasonings, McCormick & Company Inc.

The Power of People is one of our five pillars. It has been the foundation for McCormick's success for decades. There is something inspiring about working at McCormick. We have created an unusually dedicated workforce by fostering a culture of respect, recognition, inclusion and collaboration based on the highest ethical values. Without our employees, our success is not possible. Our commitment to our customers, our consumers and our employees is unsurpassed.


 Lead Producer 
 , Packaging Graphics Manager


 McCormick & Company, Incorporated 
 , a global leader in flavor, is seeking a full-time position for the 
 Lead Producer – Production Graphics.




Position Overview



Under the direction of the Graphic Production Manager, the Packaging Producer is responsible for the development of consumer package graphics from design lock to print execution. The incumbent ensures that all packaging graphics meet design and brand objectives while adhering to legal and regulatory requirements. This position regularly interacts with Graphic Design, Marketing, Materials Management, Quality Assurance, Product Development, Product Evaluation, Package Engineering, and external printers in coordination of graphic projects.



Responsibilities 




 Manages workflow of print packaging initiatives for North America from design lock to print execution 

 Manage print proofing process to ensure quality standards are met i.e. reviewing and approving material samples, digital proofs, and physical or pre-production proofs 

 Collaborates cross-functionally to ensure initiatives meet design and brand objectives, cost and timing 

 Provide leadership with key stakeholders to ensure compliance of processes and optimize ways of working based on best practices 

 Ensure all projects’ feedback is documented and routed through the right team 
 s 
 Perform root cause analysis of production issues and provides corrective actions 

 Leads pre-production and print meetings with design team to ensure accuracy of directives for project scope, deliverables, and timing 

 Demonstrate ability to strategically connect business objectives to deliver continual value creation 

 Serve as a cross functional expert in complex packaging initiatives 

 Responsible for company-wide compliance with artwork routing and approval system 

 Robust project management with demonstrated success in managing multiple priorities 

 Strong graphic design background with ability to partner with our Creative Director and Graphic Design team to successfully move from design lock to production. 

 Able to speak Adobe Creative language and partner with external prepress vendors to translate and problem solve. 



Required Qualifications




 Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline - Graphic Design, Marketing, Project Management 

 Must have skill sets in graphic design using Adobe Creative Suite 

 Demonstrated success in prioritizing and balancing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment 

 Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills, including ability to effectively communicate at mid and senior levels of the organization 

 Strong desire and natural curiosity problem solve required including the ability to investigate complex issues and conduct root cause analysis to resolve problems 

 Ability to coordinate informational data under ambiguous and fast-moving conditions 

 Must have Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint, Teams skill set 

 Self-starter with motivation to get the job done ahead of schedule and with high quality. 

 2 Years’ experience as Lead Producer demonstrating functional graphics knowledge with Consumer labels, cartons and pouches 

 Strong skill set utilizing an Art Approval Program (ie. Blue Enterprise) 

 Must have functional knowledge regarding printing methods for Consumer labels 

 Must have functional knowledge utilizing WorkFront – a project management program 


Throughout the selection process, accommodations for applicants with disabilities are available upon request. Please notify H.R. if required.

industries: Marketing Services, Financial Services, and Retail
description:
Our Client


Our client is rapidly growing and dedicated to the development of easy-to-use, low-energy, and affordable solutions for solids management and nutrient removal. Their highly experienced teams are hyper-focused on developing and optimizing technologies that provide best-in-class operational, economic, and environmental benefits without the high cost and complexity of alternative solutions. They have permanently installed their solids management and nutrient removal solutions in facilities throughout Canada and have expanded their reach in places such as the USA, New Zealand, UK, and Latin America. Our client’s primary measurement of success lies with the customer. The ability to achieve 100% customer satisfaction is at their core, contributing significant resources to the training and development of all their teams.


The Opportunity


In part to the rapidly growing trajectory in 2022, the opportunity is for an eager and passionate individual to step in as their 
Operations Manager. 
In this role, you will possess a strong ability to work in conjunction with your team and assign the proper roles while you focus on higher-level tasks. You will be responsible for overseeing the daily management of projects and assisting in the review and feedback on proposed designs and engineering drawings. You will step into a leadership role and be required to lead various teams with differing technical skills and specialist knowledge. Additionally, you will expertly manage your time and show the ability to meet all necessary deadlines in realistic time frames. This role offers a huge growth opportunity in a fast-paced company.



Key Responsibilities




You will oversee the daily management of projects while assisting in the review and feedback on proposed designs, function specificity, and engineering drawings

Manage a high standard of operational excellence to maintain a high level of customer satisfaction, both internally and externally

Ensure your team maintains productivity standards in all phases of their operation

Review shift productivity to identify maximum efficiencies and operational opportunities

Accurate preparation of Field Reports including all materials delivered on-site with daily production shown

You will be responsible for accurately reviewing purchase orders as well as your teams’ timecards

A champion of policy and procedure, is well-positioned to plan and review compensation actions




Education/Experience




Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, and/or C. Tech, AScT, GSC Certification

Level 1 or equivalent of Occupational First Aid

Managerial experience and knowledge of construction/civil engineering design an asset

Shown the ability to read plans, schematics, shop drawings, and technical manuals, speaking to them at a high-level

Experience taking on standard operation procedures and improving upon them through the building of your team




Who You Are




A self-starter with a true passion for the environmental industry

Expert communication skills

A true connector, understands how to mentor and lead a team

Technologically savvy with an aptitude for MS Office

Excellent presentation ability

Thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment




About Peeple Inc.



Peeple Inc is a Vancouver-based People Development firm specializing in Management Search and Executive Coaching and development. We’re focused on helping companies build and develop world-class teams and assisting jobseekers to find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continuing care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible.

Peeple Inc and the clients we represent are committed to an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace, as well as complete compliance with the B.C. Human Rights Code, Canadian Human Rights Act, and the Employment Equity Act.


Application and Timeline


We encourage interested applicants to apply as soon as possible as our client is keen to welcome their newest team member. Interviews will take place as resumes are submitted through the Peeple Inc website.

Note: This role is based in Montreal and the selected candidate must be prepared to work on site at our headquarters at 7471 Leonard de Vinci, Montreal (spoiler alert: our factory is pretty awesome)! 


We’re looking for a 
Sewing Mechanic
 who will help troubleshoot, repair, and maintain industrial sewing machinery and mechanical equipment.


Sheertex
 makes the strongest pantyhose in the world. Don't just take our word for it—in 2018 we were named one of TIME's "Best Inventions"! Tens of thousands of customers have already been wowed by our growing range of products, from our bestselling Classic Sheers to our Reversible Crew Socks to Everywear Masks. We are a company that prides itself on using technology to advance a once stagnant industry. Through our initial start of creating a fibre that the hosiery industry had never used before to our ongoing push to automate our manufacturing processes; the journey of Sheertex has a common thread of striving to be innovative in our use of technology. Even our method of selling direct-to-consumer through our online channels was uncommon in the hosiery industry, and is just another way Sheertex does things a little differently.

As the 
Sewing Mechanic
, reporting to the 
Senior Production Manager
, you will be responsible for assisting in; installing, testing and troubleshooting, repairing industrial sewing machinery, electrical repairs and mechanical equipment relating to sewing.


What you can expect in the first 1-3 months:
 As you familiarize yourself with the company, culture and pace, you will learn the following:


 Understand and learn to maintain automated machinery and equipment;

 Assist in the upkeep of production materials orders when in shortage;

 Inspect equipment, structures, and production materials to identify and report the reason for errors in production and other defects;

 Differentiate machine type;

 Respond to production maintenance requests by Supervisors and/or Production Management in a timely manner;

 Perform all other duties as assigned or needed;

 Keep work area, production equipment and machines clean.




Requirements




2+ years experience working with Industrial machines 

Communicate in French or English

Able to communicate by an electronic device 

Available to work from 7:30AM to 3:30PM

Simple problem solving 

Inspect equipment and production materials to identify and report the reason for errors in production and other defects




Bonus




Experience with Sewing, Knitting or Hosiery machines

Ability to evaluate options and create alternative solutions

Basic experience with technology; scanners, computers, tablets

Operates proactively

Ability to prioritize and multi-task

Handle challenges and work as a team

Good understanding of Planned Preventive Maintenance (PPM)


Due to proprietary information and the nature of this position, if selected, we will request a Non Disclosure Agreement (NDA) be signed to enable a candid discussion of the role during the interview process.

The retail industry is notorious for its lack of diverse representation, and we're very aware of the research showing that women and other historically underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to a job if they don't believe that they meet all of the criteria.

Are you hesitant to submit an application because you're not sure if you check every box? Apply anyway!

We would love to hear from you and figure out what you can add to the culture here at Sheertex.

“Let food be thy medicine, and let medicine be thy food.”
 – Hippocrates

A department that truly helps everyone in our home, our Dietary staff ensures that our residents are provided with nutritious and delicious meals to keep them energized and ready for each day. As a pivotal member to this team, you will prepare the meals that sustain our residents! Are you ready to get started?


You will be accountable for… 



Reviewing all menus and preparing food and following standardized recipes and production sheets 

In the absence of the Food Services Manager, assist with their responsibilities

job_title: Quality Inspector (Day Shift/$1,000 Sign on Bonus!!!!)
description:
This position offers a SIGN ON BONUS of $1,000!!!







Position Summary:  






Reporting to the Team Lead – Quality this position inspects component parts and completed product for conformance to production controls and ISO standards.






Primary/Essential Responsibilities:  






 

Perform receiving inspection as required.


 

Perform In-process and final inspection tasks on all switches and part orders being shipped.


 

Perform internal process/ quality system audits as required, report all findings.


 

Position has the authority to “shut down” non-conforming processes after notifying Supervisor, Quality Manager and Director of Operations.


 

Communicate drawing discrepancies to Engineering.


 

Participate in Customer inspection as needed.


 

Create and Assist team members in writing and entering NCRs.


 

Assist in evaluation of non-conforming components, such as conducting dimensional analysis of components to help identify potential issues as needed, material sorting / quarantined / dispositioning.


 

Write CAR/CIIs for audits and assist employees who wish to report a problem requiring corrective action.


 

Report violations of ISO Standard to Quality Manager.


 

Participate in the prototype review process for all newly developed products as needed.


 

Review of supplier documentation including dimensional analysis, certifications, and SPC data.


 

Develop / maintain necessary documentation and assist in the control of documentation.


 

Other duties as assigned by Management. 








Required Qualifications: 






 

Ability to read and interpret drawings, schematics, bills of materials, wiring and ladder diagrams desirable.


 

Must have basic computer skills in MS Word and Excel.  Experience using an ERP system desirable.


 

Ability to utilize measuring devices such as calipers, micrometers, thread gauge, multimeter.


 

Good written and verbal communication skills.


 

Knowledgeable in GD&T, Basic Electrical testing, and welding inspection desirable.


 

High School diploma, GED or combination of work experience and skill development required.


 

1-3 years experience working in a manufacturing environment desirable.








Physical Demands / Working Conditions:  






 

Stooping           


 

Standing        


 

Light Lifting (occasional 25 lbs or less)     


 

Heavy Lifting (occasional 25 lbs +)


 

Pushing/pulling between 75-100 lbs. of force on lever arms during switch inspection on a frequent basis

Be a part of keeping the lights on for critical infrastructure needs; hospitals, manufacturing, schools, retail spaces and much more.

Sign on BONUS of $1,000!!!!!


 
Generous Profit Sharing with RRSP Program paid quarterly 

 
Comprehensive Benefit Package including life insurance, health, dental and paramedical services, paid by employer

 
Education Tuition Assistance

 
Job Security

 
Air-conditioned/heated state-of-the-art manufacturing facility

job_title: Producer – General Programming (Arts and variety entertainment) (French Services)
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing Services, and Software Development
description:
Work at CBC/Radio-Canada 


At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance.

Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.


 Your role 


We are looking for a bright, energetic and creative Producer to work on general and unscripted programming. Here’s your chance to help shape Canadian media by joining CBC/Radio-Canada to produce arts (Atelier culturel) and youth (ONIVA!) content for our platforms in Western Canada. This position will be based in Saskatchewan.

In this role, you will plan, conceive, organize and/or co-ordinate the production and realization of cross-platform content. You must demonstrate exceptional skills in verbal and written communication. The ability to generate a wide range of ideas and formats is essential. Reporting to the Director or Senior Manager, General Programming, you have good knowledge of youth and cultural trends along with the ability to actively engage audiences.

You will perform editorial assignments related to the gathering, editing, writing and online/on-air presentation of content for internal (Radio-Canada.ca, ICI TÉLÉ and ICI PREMIÈRE) and external (Facebook, Instagram and YouTube) platforms. With the goals of informing, enlightening and entertaining, you will be part of the General Programming team but could also be regularly assigned to a number of station or Communications projects. There may be the opportunity to co-ordinate the work of others, and an essential part of the position will involve working closely with local teams across Western Canada.

Work must adhere to CBC/Radio-Canada journalistic and/or program policies, standards and practices, and as Producer, you are ultimately responsible for ensuring that this occurs. Nevertheless, there is wide latitude for initiative, independent judgment and creativity. You will develop and sustain a culture of innovation and partnership with communities across Western Canada.



We Are Looking For a Candidate With The Following




 University degree or equivalent. 

 Five or more years’ recent experience, of which three must involve work in broadcasting or a closely related industry, directly related to youth and cultural initiatives. 

 Experience reporting and editing on all platforms (digital, radio, video) essential. 

 Fluency in English and French. 

 Demonstrated ability to lead a team (on site and remotely), ideally with a minimum of two years’ supervisory experience. 

 Experience preparing and producing general and unscripted programming content. 

 Ability to manage multiple priorities. 

 Stay current on new formats and engaging ideas, and produce content in innovative formats. 

 Oversee the shooting, editing and digitizing of content. 

 Write, edit and post written material in Scoop. 

 Ability to plan, select and request, in collaboration with the unit manager, the financial and production/resource requirements, including creative contributors and other participants, material and facilities. 

 Good knowledge of social media and its use. 

 Aptitude for working with and/or learning how to use complex software. 

 Creative thinker with an innovative spirit; ability to inspire innovation, generation of new ideas and continuous improvement in team members. 

 Effective communicator with strong interpersonal skills; strong team player with the local team as well as with peers and the general public. 

 Understanding of the youth market and arts scene, especially in minority-language communities; strong connection to local community and stakeholders. 

 Ability to mentor employees in Western Canada. 

 Perform other production or administrative tasks associated with the smooth functioning of General Programming production operations. 



Please attach a link to your demo with your application.



 Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.

All employees of CBC/Radio-Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of 
December 1st 2021
 unless exempted based on a medical/religious ground. As per this requirement, employees must attest to their vaccination status. The requirement for employees to be fully vaccinated applies whether they are teleworking, working remotely or working on-site. This is a condition of employment and it applies to all employees. Should you reach the point in the selection process where it is necessary to verify if you meet the conditions of employment, you will be asked to provide an attestation confirming your COVID-19 vaccination status.

If this sounds interesting, please click on ''Apply online''. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. That’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect Canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. That’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada’s public broadcaster. For more information, visit the Diversity and Inclusion section of our website. If you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.

You are invited to consult and familiarize yourself with our Code of Conduct, which can be found on our corporate website . All employees must adhere to the Code as a condition of employment. We also invite you to take a look at our policy on conflicts of interest . In the event that you become an employee, it will be important to inform us, as quickly as possible, of any situation that, because of your hiring, constitutes or could appear to constitute a conflict of interest.

description:
BE authentic . BE influential . BE the expert . Be all that and more at Colliers. 


At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.



Who You Are



You are a production-focused design professional, well known for constantly delivering accurate, quality work for your clients and successfully executing projects in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment.

As Production Graphic Designer, you will use your corporate aesthetic and strengths in both print and web design to execute tailored marketing materials, providing graphic production support to the graphic design team and working closely with the Manager, Marketing Studio to ensure graphics and production requests are executed accurately and efficiently.

Your role will be integral to the delivery of service excellence to clients through the implementation of key marketing initiatives. These include the design and output of marketing and communications programs, business development campaigns, property marketing, client presentations, special events, internal communications, and corporate communications, as well as other marketing communication collateral for our commercial brokerage teams.

You are exceptionally organized, take initiative, enjoy juggling multiple projects and changing priorities, and work well both independently and as part of a dedicated, collaborative team.



What You Bring




Graphic Design graduate, with a minimum of 3 - 5 years’ Graphic / corporate design experience in an agency setting or corporate environment.

Advanced knowledge of the Adobe Creative Cloud applications including InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, as well as Dreamweaver and CC Libraries.

Experience working in a PC environment.

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook).

Understanding and experience with corporate branding, layout, color theory & typography in both print & digital media.

Self-starter and team player with a strong attention to detail.

Excellent communication (follow-through and follow-up) skills, and ability to meet deadlines.



Bonus skills and experience




Professional Services / B2B design experience.

Experience in animation.




What Success Looks Like




You demonstrate superior client service and interpersonal skills, including the ability to relate effectively with people at all levels of the company, both internally & externally.

You take initiative and thrive in a fast-paced environment, ensuring that graphics and production requests are executed with excellent attention to detail, whilst meeting critical timelines. 

You show a clear design aptitude with a desire to learn new technologies and expand your expertise, actively participating in the Canadian marketing team.

Please include a download link or online portfolio in addition to your resume. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered.*

Let food be thy medicine, and let medicine be thy food.” – Hippocrates


Tired of living to work? Work to LIVE in beautiful Shelburne! Ask yourself three questions:



Are you looking for a role with tons of opportunity for career advancements?

Are you ready to be part of a team that will truly value your hard work, dedication and effort?

Are you passionate about providing compassionate and quality care to residents in long term care?



If the answer is yes, we would love to know more about you!

Southbridge Care Homes is looking for a qualified Cook to become part of a dynamic Food and Nutrition Department team, that ensures our Residents are provided with nutritious and delicious meals, that are prepared and served with love. If you are ready to be part of a great team that is passionate about their work and improving the lives of our Residents, this is the role for you!


Duties And Responsibilities



Reviewing menus, preparing food following standardized recipes and production sheets.

In the absence of the Food Services Manager assists with their responsibilities.

Monitor quality and quantity of food supplies and recommend corrective action when need be regarding quality.

Coaches Dietary Aides in basic food preparation procedures and in serving activities; assumes responsibility for routine departmental operations in the absence of the Food Services Manager, including staff replacements and service calls for malfunctioning equipment.

 Chef training or culinary management certificate/diploma from a program that meets the requirements of the Ontario Long Term Care Act; or

 Post-secondary diploma in food and nutrition management or a post-secondary degree in food and nutrition




Additional qualifications include:



Red Seal Cook Trade Certification preferred.

Experience in institutional large quantity cooking preferred.

Excellent communication skills, written and verbal.

Proven ability to provide direction and lead others within a busy environment.

Must possess/able to obtain a current Vulnerable Sector Criminal Record Check.

The Production Assistant facilitates administration delivery within the Show/Discipline; managing calendars, note taking, and acting as the client liaison for reviews and sends. The PA also works with the Editorial team so that all material received by the client is downloaded, dailied and tracked.

Production Assistants also set up and update show tracking documents; working with the Production Manager/Producer to input data into weekly reports and helping with the sync queue and sync tags management. The PA and coordinator teams both locally and in other facilities carry out day-to-day ad-hoc production tasks.

:

Proactive

Creative approach to resolving situations

Forward planning

Communication skills

Honest and attentive

Good written/verbal communication

People person

Collaborative spirit

Previous knowledge of the film industry

Previous experience working in a post-production environment

TD Description


Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com
 


Department Overview



Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD 


We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.


TD IT Operations
 is home to a team of highly-valued professionals recognized for both their customer-service mindsets and dedication to seamless 24-7 running of our infrastructure technologies. They also manage what we call the implementation and delivery life cycle for IT components across the various technology groups. Component installation, maintenance and decommissioning, operational or help desk support, system performance, capacity and availability monitoring, migration, emerging technology assessment, implementation, release management and deployment support - you name it.

There's room to grow in all of it.
 


Job Description



About This Role 


We are looking for someone with diverse skills and some background in this space to carry out a broad range of operational service and support assignments.You'll join others in environment management, maintenance, monitoring, performance and incident management, as well as production support activities. There's meaningful work at every turn! 

Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. 
Here's some of what you may be asked to perform: 



  Support applications and systems by meeting or exceeding standards and service levels while minimizing operational risk.  

 Promptly schedule packaging and new applications releases, engage partners. plan parallel work streams when possible. 

 Partner closely with stakeholders to improve production environment stability. 

 Actively involved on all aspects of the application/system support and application issue resolution: identify, assess, recommend, escalate, resolve, report, document and communicate. 

 May focus on problem determination including data gathering and analysis. 

 May develop scripts using appropriate tools to address gaps, simplify or enhance  the application/system or environment. 

 Provide quality service and solutions consistent with objectives and client requirements. 

 Effectively handle incident management for outages. 

 Ensure timely notification and escalation of possible issues/problems, options and recommendations for prompt resolution. 

 Dive into design, review, and integration of all application requirements like functional, security, integration, performance, quality and operations. 

 Identify, address application/ data issues, cross-capability and cross-release issues that affect application integrity. 

 Provide expertise to other functional areas (technology, trends and processes).   

 Join projects aimed at evolving the base infrastructure, deploying new technologies, or optimizing the operational environment. 

 Deploy base infrastructure components for all environments.  

 May be involved in application deployment (“off the shelf” or in-house) and procurement. 

 Follow change management procedures. ensure proper testing, sign-off, monitoring. 

 Monitor system life cycles, ensure specifications and functionality support business. objectives and architecture decisions. 

 Use meaningful metrics to monitor environment's performance. 

 Participate in disaster recovery planning (Define, Review, Test). 



 


Job Requirements



What can you bring to TD?
 Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have: 


  Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate. 

 3-5 years relevant experience. 

 Ability to work on assignments that involve applications and systems of moderate to high complexity, under minimal supervision. 

 Readiness and confidence in installing, configuring, upgrading of business applications/systems in co-ordination with appropriate stakeholders. 



 


Additional Information



Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:



Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.

Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, 



 


Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve.  If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Location: Multimatic Anton Manufacturing, Concord, Ontario, Canada

Posted: March 1st, 2022

Anton Manufacturing is a production facility of Multimatic Inc. and is a leading supplier of stampings, hinges, door checks and mechatronic products to the North American automotive industry. Anton Mfg. uses flexible production systems that allow rapid product changeovers, helping drive manufacturing efficiency.

Multimatic Anton is currently looking for a Materials Manager who will be responsible for co-ordinating the activities of the Materials function to ensure that the needs of the customer are met. This member of the Management team plays an important role in the company's commitment to supplying superior quality parts, on time, to our customers.



Plant Address



Multimatic Anton

300 Basaltic Road

Concord, ON L4k 4Y9



Key Responsibilities




 Establish and monitor overall procedures, methods, projects, policies, and programs designed to improve MRP control efficiency and company profitability

 Advise other department managers of any potential problems, concerns and opportunities for improvement.

 Meet or exceed all objectives/requirements of the business plan.

 Follow up on correspondence with Anton's Customers and Suppliers as required.

 Utilize MRP software system to aid in the scheduling of manufactured parts and outside processing vendors

 Provides and/or receives information as to when our customer's deliveries will be increasing or decreasing and when vacation shut downs will occur.

 Closely monitor Vendors or Suppliers delivery methods or requirements and receive information to any occurrences of interrupted delivery schedules and premium freight.

 Ensure good working relationships are maintained with vendors and suppliers to ensure continued good will and smooth inter-company transactions

 Aid in the sourcing of all materials, components, outside processes, and contracts.

 Maintain the confidentially of the company and its business.

 Inventory control

 Constantly monitor industry pricing and product cost in order to maintain the best possible overall profitability for the company.

 Keep informed on the latest changes to Customs Procedures and inform other department and employees, especially in regards to NAFTA and the Automotive Trade Agreement

 In the event of receiving a customer concern (verbal or electronic), issues customer/concern report

 Ensure compliance to all Health & Safety rules and housekeeping principals. Ensure substandard conditions and practices identified in monthly plant safety audits are corrected.

 Works in compliance with IATF 16949 and ISO 14001 standards

 Will work in compliance with all legislative requirements of the OHSA




Qualifications




 Completion of a Community College Diploma or a University Degree. A professional designation in either Materials or Purchasing ( CPIM or APIC)

 (7) Seven to (10) Ten years Materials or Purchasing experience in an automotive manufacturing environment

 Good working knowledge of Purchasing and MRP systems.

 Must have experience with SAP

 Excellent problem solving techniques and methods.

 Ability to interact with all levels of employees both within the organization and with, customers, suppliers, sub-contractors, engineers, etc.

 Supervisory skills in the area of, Interaction and Communication, Orientation, Company Policies, Absenteeism, Negotiation.

 Strong computer skills in the area of: Manufacturing Control Systems, Windows, MS Office programs, etc.
