At 
Mainframe Studios
, we’re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. We’ve been doing this for 25+ years, and we’re still going strong. We’re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. We’ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder we’ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.


WE WANT YOU
 (and your mad skills)!

The Render Wrangler facilitates the efficient and consistent rendering of all production digital data including animation, lighting passes, compositing and DI. Additionally they monitor all output for quality control.


While our studio remains in beautiful Kitsilano, Vancouver, we have transitioned all of our staff to work from home during these difficult times of the COVID-19 outbreak. Our technology allows our employees to log in remotely to our on-site workstations with little or no noticeable difference from the way they worked in our studio. We now have team members working all across BC, and are happy to consider that option into the future for many positions!



Responsibilities And Duties



Monitors render queue efficiency.

Ensures that priority jobs from production are completed both successfully and in a timely manner.

Provides render technical support. 

Identifies, reports, and finds solutions to technical rendering and compositing errors. 

Creates daily reports for each production documenting efficiencies, problems and priorities.

Communicates relevant information to Wrangler Manager, Production Managers, Coordinators and Technical Directors.

Provides bug reports and feedback on render-relevant software tools.

Ensures all rendered layers are complete and error-free.Aligns and engages with the values of Mainframe: a culture of community, connectivity, creativity and collaboration.

Interacts respectfully and professionally with colleagues, other staff members, partners and clients. 




Qualifications And Skills



University and/or diploma in fine arts or animation or equivalent experience is preferred.

1+ years of industry experience is preferred.

Knowledge of Maya, Katana, Nuke and/or other DCCs is an asset.

Knowledge of PipelineFX’s Qube or other render queuing software is beneficial.

Highly organized and responsible.

Python scripting and web development are beneficial.

Ability to comprehend proprietary software.

Solid work ethic and positive attitude. 

Efficient and detail oriented with an ability to multitask. 

Strong problem solving skills and ability to work collaboratively.

Ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely.

Ability to deliver work on time and meet set performance objectives.

Must be willing to work weekends and graveyard shifts.



--


Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners.

POSITION TITLE: Customer Care Manager - Operations

Position Location: Remote

Company Description:

MaxSold, the leading estate sales marketplace, empowers buyers and sellers to extend the life of things for new generations to love.❤️ With presence in Canada and the US, MaxSold serviced 1,157 communities and 116,630 clients in 2021. By 2031, MaxSold aspires to be the global market leader for downsizing, estate sales and clearing excess items. MaxSold is known for its dedication to its core values: Commitment to Customers, Accountability for Results, and Resourcefulness in Achieving our Mission.

Position Description:

If sustainability, upcycling, and mindful consumerism excite you, MaxSold may be the perfect fit! The Customer Care Manager reports directly to the VP of Operations, and comes with a great deal of autonomy to make decisions and shape a process that provides best in class customer experience in every transaction. We are in a period of rapid growth, and are looking for the star quality that will allow us to make customer service at the center of that growth.

This is a work from home position, and therefore you must meet the minimum IT requirements of High speed internet, minimum speed of 10-15Mbps download and 4-6Mbps upload." If you are unable to meet these requirements, unfortunately, you will not be considered for this role.

Whilst the ideal candidate would be located in Kingston, or GTA, this is flexible for the right candidate.

In addition to supporting the growth projects of MaxSold, you will also have primary responsibility for:


Drive and manage changes, enhancements to our customer satisfaction surveys based on best-in-class methodologies for engagement, CES and NPS

Design and communicate standard processes and cadences for customer experience engagements that encompasses how we manage internally

Gain alignment on CX surveys, metrics, and methodology with several leaders among multiple verticals by synthesizing requirements coming from many functions and demonstrating a solid working knowledge of requirements to stakeholders and sponsors

Work with stakeholders and sponsors to define and implement closed-loop mechanisms

Provide monthly CX Intelligence analysis and recommendations to leadership teams

Work with leadership teams in driving project roadmap for customer satisfaction and advocacy efforts, including business requirements documentation and communications

Define and implement metrics to measure and communicate success

Identify areas of risk to the project scope or timeline, and escalate to program leadership in a timely manner

Review, monitor and track customer issue as reported on slack channels associated with service delivery

Take ownership in assisting, researching, resolving, and de-escalating customer issues and the CX and report to the cross-functional Directors

Continuously look for opportunities to streamline and improve the CX related programs and processes

Responsible for collation and publication of positive customer feedback internally & externally (via social media channels)

Collaborate with Training department for review and delivery of CX training



Work/Life Balance

Our team values work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between personal and professional life is crucial to happiness and success at MaxSold. We are happy to offer a flexible schedule so team members can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better, more well-rounded professionals and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture

Here at Maxsold, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. Our core values and leadership principles guide our team members to seek diverse perspectives, to learn from one another, to be curious and to build trust.

Required Qualifications:


Previous experience of CX at a managerial level

Proven track record of driving NPS within a growing organization

Ability to take customers from “Ow to Wow” through effective communication

Previous experience in training customer service preferred

Good knowledge of all major social network platforms and cultivating positive feedback



In addition:


You have a drive to continuously improve.

You strive to do the right thing, every time.

You are happy to give thanks to those who deserve it.

You are comfortable in admitting your mistakes and open to learning from them.

You want to make an impact, every day!



MaxSold is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MaxSold is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

CAREERS AT ALL WEATHER WINDOWS





Plant 1-Quality Assurance Technician-





 
As Canadas’s largest privately-owned window and door manufacturer, we are one of the most recognizable names in the industry. Founded in 1978, All Weather Windows operates 8 locations across the country and 2 manufacturing plants. All Weather Windows has been named to Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies. We are currently recruiting for a Quality Assurance Technician to join our Plant 1 Manufacturing team.



The QA Tech is responsible for auditing of raw material and finished product to ensure quality and performance comply with established product standards.



The Ideal Candidate will bring a proven track record in a manufacturing setting and demonstrated multitasking ability in a multi-cultural workforce.  They will bring knowledge of flow-line production, lean manufacturing, and Quality Control or Assurance experience.



Reporting to the QA Manager, the QA Tech responsibilities will include:




Checking dimensions of finished products against CAD drawings and work traveler specifications

Checking along production lines to ensure quality standards are in compliance with product specifications during product manufacturing

Completing DPFs for defective raw materials

Sending completed DPF and a sample of defective raw material to supplier, Supervisor, and other involves parties

Populating scheduled inspection sheets and documenting detailing testing and investigations

Performing chamber testing on random finished product samples- air and water testing

Assessing defective product returns from customers

Determining cause of defect

Deciding the disposition of the claim

Writing and submitting a detailed report on findings to the RMA requestor

Troubleshooting quality problems, investigating causes and proposing solutions

Outcome: high quality products that meet established standards


Qualifications include:




Strong verbal and written English communication skills

Strong math skills

Analytical skills

Critical thinking

Able to accurately use precision measurement equipment

Time- management and prioritizing skills

Ability to read and interpret CAD/technical drawings

Ability to use and interpret metric and imperial systems.



Qualified candidates may apply by visiting our careers page at 
www.allweatherwindows.com/careers.




We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

job_title: Senior Specialist, Medical device development, mechanical engineering
industries: Medical Equipment Manufacturing and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Senior Specialist, Medical device development, mechanical engineering - Kirkland






Jubilant DraxImage, a subsidiary of Jubilant Pharma Holdings Inc, is currently recruiting for a Senior Specialist, Medical device development, mechanical engineering to join our growing team!






What can we offer?






A culture that values opportunity for professional growth and development, highly competitive base pay, comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs, group retirement savings program, health and wellness programs.

Jubilant DraxImage Inc. is a rapidly growing company with offices in Kirkland, QC and Yardley, PA. A global leader in the development of radiopharmaceuticals and state-of-the-art technologies, we are continuously seeking high caliber professionals to join our team. Jubilant DraxImage is a proud member of the Jubilant Pharma family. For more information, visit www.draximage.com




We will, with the utmost care for the environment and society, continue to enhance value for our customers and stakeholders by providing innovative products and economically efficient solutions’ through growth, cost effectiveness and wise investment of resources.

If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today!

Jubilant Pharma Holdings Inc and all our subsidiaries proudly embraces diversity in our workforce. Our goal is to have a workforce as diverse as the patients and clients we serve. We have an inclusive environment where our employees can thrive and where our differences are welcomed. By welcoming our differences, we create products that are beneficial for our patients, clients, and overall human health.








Purpose of the job :






Member of the Medical Device development team and serves as technical lead for the mechanical design aspects of Medical Devices from concept through to commercialization (e.g.: Generation of hardware design inputs, hardware risk analysis, conception, prototype generation, hardware verification and validation) and into continuous life cycle management. 






Key Accountabilities :






Serves as a member of the Medical Device development team and leads design activities for the mechanical design of Medical Devices. 

Develop Requirements Specifications to a technical level and all standards for medical devices. 

Write and execute protocols for design verification and validation

Lead test method development in coordination with the QA and validation teams. 

Oversee and perform testing and inspection of prototypes and pre-production products

Lead investigation of device failures to determine root cause and corrective action

Prepare detailed product specifications and DMRs for devices

Prepare documentation to support design history files and regulatory submissions

Design tooling and test fixtures to support product testing and clinical evaluation.

Consult with product manager and clinicians when necessary, to facilitate proper design of new or modified products.

Lead/Participate in design reviews

Experience with verification and process validation including statistical rationale

Support the development of intellectual property

Lead product and process risk assessments

Performs additional duties as assigned by Management






Qualifications:



Bachelor degree in Mechanical Engineering. 

Member of the OIQ

5 Years Medical Device Experience.

Experience designing medical carts for the EU and US markets. (Required)

Experience designing medical tubing/catheters or other sterile products[Ec1] (Asset)

Experienced in DFX (Design for manufacturability/assembly, Design for usability, Design for serviceability) (Asset)

Experienced in designing medical devices to comply with IEC 60601-1 & 60601-1-2, ISO 13485:2016, ISO 14971: 2019, IEC 62366:-1: 2015 (Asset)

job_title: Directeur des activités commerciales, ventes / Senior Business Operations Manager, Sales
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description



Aimeriez-vous travailler avec la direction des ventes sur les analyses financières opérationnelles et commerciales? Souhaiteriez-vous travailler sur la modélisation, la production de rapports et les prévisions financières, ainsi que la qualité des données et le soutien aux opérations relativement à la clientèle? Amazon Web Services (AWS) recherche un directeur des activités commerciales qui occupera un rôle central dans notre organisation pour le secteur public. Vous occuperez un poste décisif et travaillerez en collaboration avec un directeur des ventes et d'autres dirigeants concernés sur l'organisation commerciale, les bonnes pratiques et la croissance d'AWS. Notre équipe s'efforce également de soutenir ses nouveaux membres. Les niveaux d'expérience et d'ancienneté de nos équipes sont très divers, et nous favorisons un environnement du partage des connaissances et du mentorat.

En tant que directeur des activités commerciales, vous serez responsable de la formalisation des rapports financiers et commerciaux d'AWS Canada pour le secteur public. Vous établirez des tableaux de bord, des critères opérationnels et des rapports afin de gérer la croissance rapide des activités d'AWS pour le secteur public. Vous dirigerez également les activités commerciales, telles que la production des rapports d'activités mensuels et trimestriels, l'examen des pipelines, la gestion des opportunités ainsi que l'élaboration d'autres critères et rapports périodiques.

Le directeur des activités commerciales collabore avec les responsables des ventes pour prévoir et évaluer la réalisation des quotas de vente. Il soutient l'exécution des activités en fonction des commissions et des quotas planifiés, des territoires définis, des mouvements de comptes, des rapports et des informations à l'attention de la direction des ventes. Le directeur des activités commerciales réfléchit de manière stratégique et agit de façon tactique. Il dispose d'un bon jugement critique et de solides compétences analytiques. Il entretient d'étroites relations de travail, dispose de compétences organisationnelles et fait preuve d'une capacité à structurer et contrôler. Il sait communiquer avec divers types de parties prenantes (avec ou sans connaissances techniques) issues de différentes régions.



Principales Responsabilités




 Gérer les analyses et rapports financiers pour un secteur d'activités public, en veillant à l'exactitude, à la précision et au respect des échéances.

 Définir des critères et produire des rapports pour gérer les pipelines de ventes, les produits facturés et la réalisation des quotas.

 Diriger l'élaboration de modèles et méthodes de prévision sur la base de l'analyse quantitative des performances des équipes de vente.

 Mettre au point des tableaux de bord de performances qui englobent les principaux critères.

 Rédiger des exposés et diriger la création des rapports d'activités trimestriels.

 Émettre des recommandations et soutenir l'évolution, l'intégration et la mise en œuvre de la veille stratégique et des outils de gestion des relations avec la clientèle.

 Diriger la planification territoriale, la segmentation des comptes et l'élaboration des quotas.

 Gérer le processus de planification locale et exécuter une routine opérationnelle : rapports d'activités trimestriels et mensuels, 2x2, planification opérationnelle, ateliers stratégiques extérieurs, etc.

 Gérer le suivi et la direction des effectifs.


Are you interested in working with Sales leadership on operations and business financial analysis? Do you find it interesting to work with customer financial modeling, reporting, forecasting, data quality and operations support? We at Amazon Web Services (AWS) are hiring within our Public Sector (PS) organization for a pivotal Business Operations Manager (BOM) role. You will have significant impact, working with a sales director and related leaders on business orchestration, best practices, and AWS growth. Our team is also dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.

As a BOM, you will lead formalization of the financial and business reporting for AWS Canada PS. You will establish dashboards, operational metrics, and reports to manage the rapid growth of AWS PS business. You will also be responsible for driving business activities such as monthly and quarterly business reviews, pipeline reviews, opportunity management and other periodic reporting and metrics. The BOM collaborates with sales managers to evaluate and forecast attainment against quotas, plus supports business execution regarding commission and quota plans, territory definitions, account movements, and reporting and insights for sales leadership.

The BOM will think strategically, act tactically, and display strong analytical and critical thinking skills. You will have strong working relationships, organizational skills, and ability to establish structure/control. You are able to communicate well across geographies and stakeholder types (technical or non-technical).



Key Responsibilities Include




 Managing PS financial reporting and analysis for a business vertical, ensuring timeliness, completeness and accuracy of reporting

 Developing metrics and reports to manage sales pipeline, billed revenue and quota attainment

 Leading development of forecast models/methodologies, owning quantitative analysis of sales team performance

 Developing performance dashboards that encompass key metrics

 Authoring narratives and leading the creation of quarterly business reviews

 Making recommendations and supporting the evolution, integration, and implementation of business intelligence and CRM tools

 Leading territory planning, account segmentation & quota development

 Managing local planning process and running operational cadence: quarterly and monthly business reviews, 2x2s, operational planning, offsite strategy workshops, et al.

 Managing headcount tracking and management


Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional lives is crucial to your happiness and success at Amazon, so we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life.

A day in the life



About The Hiring Group



Job responsibilities



About Us



Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.




Basic Qualifications




 Au moins 7 ans d'expérience dans la finance, la gestion opérationnelle ou la direction commerciale, dans des organisations mondiales de vente de taille moyenne ou grande.

 Au moins 5 ans d'expérience dans le développement et la mise en œuvre de systèmes, de processus et d'outils pour la gestion des relations avec la clientèle, la rémunération variable, la prévision des recettes et la production de rapports sur les recettes.

 Au moins 2 ans d'expérience d'utilisation des outils de veille stratégique et des logiciels de gestion des relations avec la clientèle.

 Au moins 3 ans d'utilisation de Salesforce.

 Diplôme universitaire ou collégial de quatre ans, ou expérience de travail supplémentaire équivalente. Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication écrite et verbale, en français et en anglais.

 7+ years of experience in finance, business management or sales operations, in medium to large global sales organization

 5+ years of experience with development and implementation of systems, processes and tools utilized for CRM, variable compensation, revenue reporting and forecasting

 2+ years of experience using BI tools, CRM and software

 3+ Years of Salesforce experience

 4-year university/college degree; in lieu of a degree, we will consider additional years of work experience


Strong verbal and written communication skills, in French and English



Preferred Qualifications




 Connaissance technique de Tableau afin d'assurer une production de rapports et une automatisation de haute qualité; capacité à créer des analyses ad hoc et des tableaux de bord complexes.

 Excellente maîtrise d'Excel pour l'élaboration de rapports ad hoc complexes, avec notamment des tableaux croisés dynamiques, des macros et la production automatisée de rapports.

 Excellentes aptitudes à communiquer à l'oral comme à l'écrit et capacité à travailler de manière efficace au sein d'organisations internes et externes

 Expérience des modèles opérationnels de revenus récurrents; capacité à prévoir le comportement des marchés en fonction de règles statistiques et de modèles mathématiques.

 Expérience dans l'industrie des TI, avec une connaissance particulière des tendances en matière de nuage.

 Expérience de travail dans une entreprise à forte croissance dans le domaine des technologies.

 Connaissance du secteur public et des achats publics, ainsi que des politiques et mandats régissant le processus.

 MBA spécialisé dans les affaires ou la finance.

 Esprit d'initiative, capacité à accomplir pleinement des tâches multiples avec un sens des priorités.

 Capacité à mener des analyses pointues et créatives de données complexes et à traduire les résultats en informations, messages et présentations exploitables.

 Capacité à agir avec succès dans une organisation agile et dynamique qui évolue rapidement.

 Sens des affaires, solides compétences d'analyses et capacité éprouvée à prendre des responsabilités et à diriger des analyses orientées sur les données pour soutenir et développer une entreprise.

 Technical knowledge of Tableau, to ensure high quality on reporting and automation; ability to create ad hoc analysis and complex dashboards

 Proficient Excel skills, to develop complex ad hoc reports, including pivots, macros and report automation

 Strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations

 Experience with recurring-revenue business models; ability to predict and forecast business behavior based on statistical rules and mathematical models

 Experience in the IT industry, with specific knowledge about cloud trends

 Experience working within a high-growth technology company

 Familiarity with PS and knowledge of government acquisitions, along with applicable mandates and policies that govern the process

 MBA, with concentration in business or finance

 Self-motivated, active multi-tasker with a great sense of urgency and follow-through

 Ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analyses of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, messages, and presentations

 Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization that can scale quickly

 Exhibits sound business judgment, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership and leading data-driven analyses to support and grow a business




Company
 - Amazon Web Services Canada, In

Liaise with subcontractors and suppliers via contracts and buyers. -Support the Program Manager with control of the program. Lead regular program reviews, design reviews (internal and external), audits and staff meetings. -Support program meetings with the customer to review technical activities, team activities, non-conformances, deviation and waivers and progress meetings -Work with cross-functional teams include: Electrical Design, Software, Mechanical Design, Mechanical Engineering, Controls Engineering, Stress Engineering *Skills:* Project Manager, Project Engineer, Electrical/Electro-mechanical engineering, Scheduling planning, PMP certification, MS project, Excel, aerospace, e *Additional Skills & Qualifications:* Electrical Project Engineering/Program Management experience working with cross-functional teams and interfacing with the customer: Budgeting, estimating and scheduling experience 1) MS Project, Primavera P6 or Excel

At The Focus we recognize that great visual effects can only be produced with great talent. The most advanced technologies can only go so far without talented people wielding them. This is why we created the Focus, a careers hub for professionals enabling them to advance in their career and make the best of their experience in the creative industry. Supported by a team of experts, The Focus provides career guidance, learning opportunities and industry insights, while offering access to a portfolio of award-winning creative studios around the world. Our vision is to build a diverse community of professionals from all backgrounds by improving access to the creative industry.


Job Description


The Focus is looking for a Graphic Designer with a track record in producing compelling creative work and an interest in film, broadcast and entertainment media.

The role will primarily provide design support for The Focus marketing team in helping to deliver recruitment campaigns and branding, by promoting the work delivered by our leading VFX studios from pre-production through to final VFX. This is a global role working across locations, including: London, LA, Toronto, Montreal, Adelaide, and Bangalore and provides an opportunity to support across the wider Film & Episodic business.

The Graphic Designer works closely with the Focus team, the Creative Director and the marketing leads for each of the brands and reports to the Focus marketing manager.


What You’ll Do



Deliver creative visual assets, digital static and motion design that brings our brand to life

Design compelling social layouts that support social messaging

Concept and develop content for social campaigns

Work closely with our Creative Director in LA to come up with new concepts and artwork design for use across all channels and templates whilst ensuring brand consistency

Collaborate with our marketing, recruitment, and internal teams to deliver the best solutions for our projects

Become a brand ambassador by owning and supporting of our new brand guidelines, making sure our brand is consistently used and supporting others in understanding and implementing them

Take ownership of projects, from concept through to completion

Work across multiple project deadlines

Quick turnaround on producing creative and topical social media graphics

Proactive presentation of new ideas



Qualifications



What You’ll Need:



Proven experience as a visual, brand, and/or motion designer

Proven experience with Adobe Creative Cloud apps

Proficiency in AfterEffects, PremierePro, and other video-based software

Must have a broad and highly skilled portfolio of work across 2D, 3D, layout, typography, style frames and branding.

A natural DIY ethos: what you can concept, you can also create

Has a proven ability to produce cutting-edge creative work and a passion for and understanding of design, including typography and layout.

Embraces challenges and new methods of thinking

Experience in creating visual designs and videos for websites and social platforms

Your skills and visual output will be at the heart of our creative output, so you must be on the search for new and innovative design ideas.



Any Of The Following Technical Skills Is a Bonus



Creating hi-fidelity product designs, design ideas, user flows, wireframes, sitemaps and prototypes

UX and interaction design



Additional Information


Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to talent@thefocus.com and we'll be happy to assist.

description:
Equal Opportunity Employer

Thank you for your interest in Waste Management. In response to COVID-19, we will be conducting our review process through creative solutions. Your patience and flexibility is appreciated as our process may involve virtual solutions and take longer than normal. Interview process and timing may be delayed and will vary by site.

Waste Management (WM), a Fortune 250 company, is the leading provider of comprehensive waste and environmental services in North America. We are strongly committed to a foundation of operating excellence, professionalism and financial strength. WM serves nearly 25 million customers in residential, commercial, industrial and municipal markets throughout North America through a network of collection operations, transfer stations, landfills, recycling facilities and waste-based energy production projects.



Job Summary



The 
Truck Maintenance Manager
 is responsible for managing the full fleet of primary and secondary equipment within the assigned area, in alignment with corporate objectives. Span of Control: 2 locations and approximataely 51 frontline assets.



Essential Duties And Responsibilities



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential duties satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned and may vary by location.


 Continually focuses on achieving market base profitability through effective management of all fleet and maintenance activities within the assigned area, including cost control, employee development, and high training and safety standards. 

 Reviews capital equipment requisitions in line with Corporate guidelines and objectives. 

 Ensures safe and reliable vehicles are available to meet operational requirements. 

 Manages effective utilization of vehicle assets. 

 Conducts fleet evaluations to ensure maintenance standards are met. 

 Ensures maintenance shops are adequately staffed and mechanics are properly trained. 

 Ensures vehicle management systems are effectively utilized. 

 Complies with and ensures adherence to Waste Management’s Mission to Zero standards and regulations to encourage safe and efficient operations. 

 Meets all financial review dates and corporate directed programs in a timely fashion. 

 Assists in budget process as required. 

 Ensures the cleanliness and maintenance of the maintenance shops through regular inspections and preventive maintenance programs. 

 Oversees personnel needs of the department including selecting, coaching, disciplining, and training employees and evaluating employee performance. Provides input into termination, compensation, and promotion decisions. 

 Conducts and/or attends and contributes to periodic driver/safety meetings to maintain favorable working relationships among all employees and promote maximum morale, productivity, and efficiency. 

 Provides training and presentations as needed in a positive and professional manner. 

 Updates and submits required reports in a timely manner. 





Supervisory Responsibilities



The highest level of supervisory skills required in this job is the management of supervisory employees.



Qualifications



The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.


 Education and Experience 


Education: Bachelor’s Degree or, in lieu of degree, High School Diploma or GED and three (3) years of relevant work experience.

Experience: Three (3) years of relevant work experience as well as experience in a supervisory role (in addition to education requirement).


 Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements

 Valid driver’s license required with acceptable driving record 

 310T license considered an asset 

 Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required

 Fleet Management experience required. 

 Leadership experience in employee relations. Mentoring hourly and salary staff as well as performance management. 

 Safety Leadership experience 



 Work Environment 


Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc.) most of the work day;

Required to exert physical effort in handling objects less than 30 pounds rarely;

Required to be exposed to physical occupational risks (such as cuts, burns, exposure to toxic chemicals, etc.) rarely;

Required to be exposed to physical environment which involves dirt, odors, noise, weather extremes or similar elements occasionally;

Normal setting for this job is: office setting.



Benefits



At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company match on RRSP, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.

If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click "Apply.”

Waste Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Waste Management welcomes and encourages applications from candidates with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process. If you require disability-related accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact Careers at Careers@wm.com

Multiple Location Options


Shift

description:
Master Halco, the largest manufacturer/distributor of fencing products in North America, has an immediate opportunity for a Manufacturing Administrative Assistant & Operations. This is a cross functional role requiring 40% in the office and 60% on the production floor.


Master Halco, le plus grand manufacturier/distributeur de produits de clôture en Amérique du Nord, a un poste disponible immédiatement pour un 


Adjoint administratif à la fabrication et opérations.



Il s’agit d’un rôle interfonctionnel nécessitant 40% au bureau et 60% sur le plancher de production.

This is a very exciting time to join our company. We are continuing to grow (70 locations), introducing new products, making technological investments, and implementing innovative marketing strategies. We are also focused on our people -- our most important resource. At Master Halco, we believe in transparency, open communication, and rewarding success with a path to fully develop your potential while building a career.


C'est une période très excitante pour rejoindre notre entreprise. Nous poursuivons notre croissance (75 succursales), introduisons de nouveaux produits, réalisons des investissements technologiques et mettons en œuvre des stratégies marketing innovantes. Nous mettons également l’emphase sur nos employés, qui sont notre ressource la plus importante. Chez Master Halco, nous croyons que le succès, la transparence et la communication ouverte méritent d’être récompensés tout en vous permettant de développer pleinement votre potentiel en construisant votre carrière.



Why Join our Company?



Eligible for $2500 retention bonus (paid in two installments, half at 90 days of employment and half at 120 days)

Competitive pay rate of CAD $29.00/hr

A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion 

Lucrative compensation package

RSP Plan with company match

 Une culture qui valorise les opportunités de croissance, de développement et de promotion interne

 Programme complet d’assurances médicale et dentaire

Tri et traitement du courrier

Répondre aux courriels

Préparation des documents de transport pour les chargements (cela inclut des documents personnalisés pour les chargements USA)

Dépôt des documents du bureau (documents de transport, factures, po, documents de réception, feuilles de comptage de cycle)

Dans l’atelier, assurez-vous que les palettes produites sont extraites des machines et remplacées par de nouvelles

Dans l’atelier, assurez-vous que les broches de matières premières sont placées à chaque poste de travail en fonction de la clôture en cours de production

Dans la boutique, ramasser les épingles vides et les placer dans la zone d’attente.

Dans la boutique, en s’assurant que toutes les machines en production ont les étiquettes d’identification imprimées (étiquettes zébrées)

Dans la boutique, aider à l’ouverture des épingles en cas de besoin

Recevoir des livraisons, vérifier les bordereaux d’emballage et faire la réception dans le système

Dans l’atelier, prendre des poids pour les livraisons de matières premières

Aider le directeur de l’usine à accomplir d’autres tâches au besoin

Anglais et Français écrit *

1 - 2 ans d’expérience en entreprise

Démontrer la capacité de gérer de l’information qui pourrait être confidentielle

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Job Description


Job Description Senior Data Engineer - Energy

Position Description

Ready to join an outstanding culture that cares about diversity and inclusion, corporate social responsibility and gives the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, and chart an exciting career?

CGI is more than just an IT company. Be part of a team that supports the local community with the ability draw on global best-in-class talent! Benefits include a share purchase program, profit sharing, wellness credits, training and development programs, and flexible work schedules and locations.

CGI is looking for a Data Engineer for its growing team in Western Canada to help our customers in the energy sector on their digital transformation journey!

This position is ideal for someone who is looking to take on a challenging role in delivering complex data engineering for AI, machine learning, and analytic solutions on various cloud platforms with clients in the energy sector. The successful candidate will demonstrate a breadth of understanding established and emerging data engineering technologies and experience in the energy sector. Experience with complex data integration, DevOps, DataOps, big data processing, predictive analytics, and data visualization in the energy industry are expected.

Your future duties and responsibilities

We help our energy clients with numerous types of projects covering a variety of different business scenarios including supporting data for business intelligence, data governance and management, customer relationship management, asset management, and enterprise resource planning. The data engineer will have the skills to communicate and deliver modern data engineering products to solve different business problem while building close relationships with both client and CGI team members:

Develop new systems to provide real-time streaming analytics and event processing pipeline based on high velocity data architecture to handle throughput over millions of events per second

Develop enterprise grade data lake to support both business analytical needs and next generation data infrastructure

Develop data integration toolkit to build and manage automated and efficient data pipelines that will consume data from backend services into data repositories and various formats to be consumable by reporting systems and analysts

Help create and implement DataOps, DevOps, and CICD best practices

Support data science teams in developing and deploying new algorithms

Create infrastructure to monitor and manage data integrity and data systems health

Leverage and contribute to industry best practices including proper use of source control, code reviews, data validation and testing

Create and implement engineering best practices and collaborate in the design of effective streamlined processes with partner teams


Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role


5+ years of experience in data management, data engineering and/or software engineering working with SQL, Python, Scala, Java, Databricks, Snowflake/Snowpipes, Azure Data Factory, Informatica, AWS Pipelines, and Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, or GCP)

Experience in designing, implementing, automating and maintenance of large-scale data pipeline processes, providing proficiency with concepts like idempotency, retry and backoff strategies, data parsing techniques, invalid data handling, data staging, code reuse

Experience in developing containerized data applications and hosting data systems in container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.

Experience deploying data infrastructure

Experience in a DataOps, DevOps, CI/CD environment with technologies and platforms such as Git, Jenkins, Docker/Kubernetes, and others is an asset

Experience in rapidly prototyping a data product from scratch and leading the implementation in production.

Experience with recognized industry patterns, methodologies, and techniques assets

Experience working with RDBMS technologies including MySQL

Experience with data warehousing technologies (SQL Server, Snowflake and/or Redshift)

Experience with infrastructure including Azure & AWS (S3, Gen2 Data Lake, CloudWatch, Monitor, RedShift, Synapse, CloudFormation, Resource Manager), Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, Bazel

Experience with a broad range of data sources such as RESTful APIs, SOAP, XML, JSON, client stream, transactional, video, SCADA

Experience with ML stack, including PyTorch, Plotly / Dash, Parquet, DVC, and Dask


Build your career with us.


It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.


Skills



 Data Engineering 

 Advanced Analytics 

 Container Technology 

 Data Analysis 

 Data Warehousing 

 DevOps

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
Worker Sub-Type



Regular



Job Description



BlackBerry® QNX® is a trusted supplier of safe and secure operating systems, hypervisors, frameworks and development tools, and provides expert support and services for building the world’s most critical embedded systems. We are the embedded experts. BlackBerry QNX was born in embedded, and provides time-tested and trusted foundation software, including our deterministic microkernel real-time operating system (RTOS), safety-certified products, middleware and security solutions, all purpose-built for embedded systems.

BlackBerry QNX software is trusted by more than 68% of the Electric Vehicle market by volume, 23 of the top 25 EV manufacturers and is running in more than 195 million vehicles globally.  Our foundation products have been pre-certified to ISO 26262 ASIL D and we offer a broad range of board support packages, professional services, AUTOSAR adaptive support and middleware solutions – from acoustic management, to digital cockpits to advanced driving assistance (ADAS) - to accelerate development and help OEMs meet Start of Production (SOP) dates.

Our Engineering Services Development Group is seeking a skilled individual for network driver development for the QNX operating system. The candidate would be assisting customers and partners with integrating network devices with the QNX OS network manager. This includes developing new hardware drivers from vendor documentation, extending existing driver functionality, developing additional PHY management code, and developing ethernet switch managers. The candidate would also be responsible for estimating the scope of the development projects to support sales management. The main scope of responsibility would be driver code development but also includes performance and optimization analysis and support for developed drivers.

The ideal candidate is an intelligent enthusiastic individual with proven experience in embedded network driver development.



Responsibilities




Develop and maintain network drivers

Interact with hardware vendors for required documentation and support questions

Provide project estimates for requirements, design, implementation and testing.

Provide clear communication with development team members, technical leads and management on project status, risks and approaches

Conduct design reviews, code reviews and unit test with technical peers

Identify, analyze and resolve potentially complex problems and issues with existing driver implementations

Liaise with customers regarding product performance, problems, and system design.




Essential Skills And Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent

4+ years of Software Development experience.

Experience with relevant programming languages (C).

Knowledge and experience in some of the following; MDIO, PTP (Precision Time Protocol), networking stacks, IPv4, IPv6, network provisioning and debugging, network protocol analysis




Additional Assets




Experience in embedded and real-time systems development.

Experience with performance, memory, and post-mortem analysis.

Experience with safety systems.

Knowledge of POSIX based operating system

Experience in low-level Assembly and register-level programming.

Strong problem solving and debugging skills.

Excellent communication skills including verbal, written, and interpersonal.

High degree of motivation and ability to work both independently and in a team.




Scheduled Weekly Hours



40

job_title: Senior Manager, Supply Chain, Transportation & Warehousing
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Accounting
description:
Job Type:
 Permanent


Primary Location:
 Multiple Locations, Canada


All Available Locations:
 Toronto; Montreal

Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.

Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.

Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.


Join our Supply Chain practice! Named a leader in Supply Chain and Operations Consulting by both Gartner and Kennedy Consulting Research & Advisory.




What will your typical day look like?



Our practice has global reach and you might find yourself jumping on a flight to Montreal, Vancouver, Chicago, Hong Kong, Sweden, and many other interesting locations (Covid-19 restrictions permitted). Wherever it may be, as a Senior Manager, you will:


Lead engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; manage engagement risk; direct on-time and quality deliverables

Manage day-to-day interactions with executive clients and sponsors

Develop and maintain contact with top decision-makers at key clients; organize and lead pursuit teams; participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process; contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies

Develop practical solutions and methodologies; participate in public speaking events; get published in industry periodicals

Perform role of counselor and coach; provide input and guidance into the staffing process; actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities; provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local office




About The Team



Our Deloitte Supply Chain & Network Operations Consulting practice is the largest in the Canadian market and part of the largest consulting firm in the world. We have 150+ practitioners in our team and we are still growing. We have offices across Canada: Toronto, Montreal Vancouver, and Calgary to name only a few. We value diversity, which is why our team members come from diverse backgrounds and countries.

We work hand-in-hand with our clients across industries to improve business performance, drive shareholder value and create a competitive advantage. Our work involves developing innovative recommendations to address client issues and help senior executives through strategic decision-making. We leverage our ability to bring an end-to-end approach from a strategic roadmap through implementation and execution.

If you have ideas you are passionate about, you are welcome to explore them through: market research, proposals, recruitment, innovation labs, strategy development, AI joint ventures, and career coaching/mentorship opportunities just to name a few.



Enough about us, let’s talk about you



You are someone who:     

Has a 7+ years of consulting and/or industry experience with Logistics & Distribution and a minimum of 3 years in leading project delivery

Demonstrates expertise in one or more of the following areas:


Supply Chain Execution Strategy including:


Supply Chain Assessments

Business Process Improvement

Product Flow Improvement

Network Design

Warehouse Improvement

Transportation Improvement across Truck, Rail, Marine: Sourcing, Utilization, Routing


Transportation Management Systems (TMS) including:


Implementation methodologies including waterfall and agile

Project Management, Business Process Design, requirements & functional specifications, Testing

Modules including: Planning & Optimization, Execution, Freight Settlement


Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) including:


Implementation methodologies including waterfall and agile

Project Management, Business Process Design, requirements & functional specifications, Testing

Modules including: Warehouse Management, Inventory Optimization, Slotting Optimization, Labor Management


Warehouse Design & Implementation including:


Capacity, Slotting, FTE, MHE requirements

3PL RFP and Selection

Project Management of implementation

Consulting experience in the following industries would be considered a plus: Retail, Consumer Products, Food & Beverage, Automotive, Aerospace and Logistics & Distribution Providers



Has a strong understanding of the issues that Supply Chain executives face today, a track record of providing solutions to those issues, and a mastery of a wide range of Logistics & Distribution 

Has demonstrated ability and skill-set to successfully develop and lead major client relationships as a revenue producing practitioner

Has the ability to sell and deliver large-scale end-to-end Logistics & Distribution programs at leading companies, typically interacting at the Executive/C-level

Has outstanding interpersonal skills, demonstrated leadership skills, and an entrepreneurial spirit



Why Deloitte?


Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is 
The One Firm
 for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:


 You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.

 You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.

 You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.



The next step is yours


Sound like 
The One Firm. For You?


At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates that represents the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes candidates from Indigenous communities in support of living our values and our commitments to our Reconciliation Action Plan . We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Deloitte Canada has 52 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange, Russel Metals is one of the largest metals distribution and processing companies in North America servicing customers primarily in Canada and the United States. The company conducts business in three metals distribution segments: metals service centers, energy products and steel distributors.

Russel Metals is currently looking for a 
Plant Manager
 within our 
Ottawa + Pemco, Ontario
 location, reporting to the Branch Manager. 
This is a daytime position from Monday - Friday; 8:00am - 5:00pm, with a 1-hour lunch break.




Roles And Responsibilities




Create a safe, positive and productive work environment.

Provide leadership to the warehouse processing staff.

Identify and respond to customer needs quickly and effectively.

Plan day-to-day operations, assign manpower, authorize overtime and control costs.

Implementation and maintenance of the branch quality program.

Implementation and maintenance of the branch health and safety program.

Assist in the development of capital expenditures, budgetary requests 

Ensure maintenance programs are being completed

Coordinate with all departments to ensure production standards and branch goals are achieved.

Development and coaching of employees, delegate effectively and give meaningful feedback and recognition where appropriate.

Ensure that the business operates within corporate guidelines and all legislative requirements.




Education And Skills Required




Minimum of College diploma in engineering, business administration or related discipline or equivalent experience.

Several years of management/supervisory experience in a unionized manufacturing or production environment.

Strong interpersonal skills with proven leadership ability (lead, motivate, delegate).

Strong analytical, time management and organizational skills.

Strong planning, decision making, oral and written communication skills.

Strong project management skills.

Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).

Experienced in metals processing activities; saw cutting, loading and transport of steel.

Prior experience in process improvement programs is beneficial (i.e. lean manufacturing).

Prior experience working within a unionized environment


Russel Metals offers a competitive compensation plan that includes a competitive base salary, attractive profit-sharing plan, comprehensive benefits program, group Pension Plan, and various incentive and recognition programs.

We are an organization that is committed to the principles of Employment Equity which includes maintaining a fair, equitable and diverse workforce. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.

Reporting to the Associate Manager of Styling, the Freelance Stylist is responsible for the on-model styling of SSENSE e-commerce photoshoots. As part of our best-in-class Studio visual production team, they will ensure that all styling is consistent with the SSENSE style guide and that production / productivity targets are met. The ideal candidate has the ability to understand brand identity and art direction to fuse with their own fashion point of view. This role works cross-functionally and requires a highly collaborative style and the ability to influence and motivate to drive performance results.



Styling - 100%




Prepare and style merchandise, interpreting brands editorially and commercially, while respecting the SSENSE identity and style guides

Research designers, brands, collections, and products in preparation for each photoshoot

Manage time appropriately and collaborate with on-set production team (hair & makeup, photographers, set coordinators), Associate Producer, Producer, Studio Merchandise team, and Art Direction team to achieve daily production targets

Execute styling for a wide variety of brands to SSENSE quality and productivity standards

Maintain strict standards of quality control, staying up-to-date with SSENSE art direction

Assist the Associate Manager of Styling on ad hoc projects, as required

Stay up-to-date on industry tools, techniques, and best practices in styling




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in Fashion Design, Retail Management, or a related field

A minimum of 1 year experience in visual merchandising or fashion styling, preferably in a luxury or e-commerce environment

Strong grasp of garment construction, fabrics, colour and matching

Exceptional fashion and styling sense with a proven ability to stay ahead of trends

Strong knowledge of current fashion trends and luxury designer labels


SKILLS 




Ability to carry out creative processes in a fast paced production environment 

Team player with great communication and interpersonal skills

Creative thinker with problem solving abilities

Proven ability to process high volumes of workflow

Ability to prioritize, plan and execute




Additional Information



** All applicants must provide a portfolio of relevant original work.

job_title: Senior Manager, Supply Chain, Sourcing & Procurement
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Accounting
description:
Job Type:
 Permanent


Primary Location:
 Calgary, Alberta, Canada


All Available Locations:
 Calgary


Our Purpose


At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

Have many careers in one Firm.

Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems

Experience a firm where wellness matters.


Join our Supply Chain practice! Named a leader in Supply Chain and Operations Consulting by both Gartner and Kennedy Consulting Research & Advisory.




What will your typical day look like?



As a Senior Manager, you will be leading engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; manage engagement risk; direct on-time and quality deliverables. In addition you will be develop and maintain contact with top decision-makers at key clients; organize and lead pursuit teams; participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process; contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.



About The Team



The Deloitte Supply Chain & Network Operations Consulting practice is the largest in the Canadian market and part of the largest consulting firm in the world and growing. We work hand-in-hand with our clients from virtually every industry to improve business performance, drive shareholder value and create competitive advantage. Our work involves developing innovative recommendations to address client issues and present the findings to senior executives. Depending on the project, we evolve this storyline into a strategic roadmap and detailed project plan for execution. Ensuring client success does not stop there. We also collaborate with clients through the implementation to see the vision become a reality.

The focus does not stop with the client. There are endless options for internal projects that individuals might be passionate about leading or joining: market research, proposals, recruiting, innovation labs, strategy development, AI joint-ventures, and career coaching/mentorship just to name a few.



Enough about us, let’s talk about you



You are someone who:


Has a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 10 years of consulting and/or industry experience with Supply Chain Sourcing & Procurement and a minimum of 3 years in leading project delivery

Has a strong understanding of the issues that Supply Chain executives face today, a track record of providing solutions to those issues, and a mastery of a wide range of Supply Chain Sourcing & Procurement industry issues

Has demonstrated ability and skill-set to successfully develop and lead major client relationships as a revenue producing practitioner

Has the ability to sell and deliver large-scale end-to-end Supply Chain Sourcing & Procurement programs at leading companies, typically interacting at the Executive/C-level

Has outstanding interpersonal skills, demonstrated leadership skills, and an entrepreneurial spirit



Our shared values


While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:


Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world. 

Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility. 

Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being. 

Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions. 

Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours


Sound like 
The One Firm. For You?
 Apply by 
[insert date]
.

Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. the 
 BlackNorth Initiative .
